loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 26 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is single and has two children aged eight and ten; they attend school.

For the past ten years Kebbeh has been selling lapa, a traditional wrap-around skirt, in the local marketplace. She is applying for a 12000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more lapa for her business.

Kebbeh’s ambition is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more lapa for her business.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, está casado tiene dos hijos y tiene familiares en el extranjero, tiene siete años de dedicarse al negocio lo aprendió de su hermano y este negocio aun está en crecimiento ya que hay mas capacidad.
Solicita un prestamo porque Necesita dinero para comprar más camarones y pescado de varias clases, esto le ayudara a aumentar el inventario a generar más ingresos.
El sueño y objetivo de Fidel, es ampliar su negocio, mejorarlo para sacar adelante a su familia con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Fidel makes a living selling seafood. He is married and has two children; some of his relatives live abroad. For seven years he has worked in this business which he learned from his brother, and his business is still expanding since there is room for growth. 

He is asking for this loan because he needs money to buy more shrimp and fish of various varieties. This will help him to increase his inventory and generate more income.

Fidel's dream and goal is to expand his business and improve it in order to get his family ahead more easily.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and various types of fish

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is from a village of the Tskaltubo district. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife, 21-year-old son, and parents. His parents are pensioners.  

Bezhan owns two greenhouses where tomatoes and dills are grown. Bezhan does all the relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. The harvested production is sold locally. In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm and has a milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese products. They sell cheese at the local open market.  Bezhan is a very hard-working person, with a great experience in his work.

He requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizers for his greenhouse. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. After fertilization and properly done agricultural works, Bezhan will receive a good quality harvest and sell it for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in his agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear and clothes for children.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is from a small village in the Marneuli district. 22 and single, he lives with his 21-year-old brother and their mother. His economic activity is maintaining a 1080 square meter greenhouse where tomatoes and cucumbers are grown. Elvin also owns land where maize is grown. He does all the relevant seasonal works to insure a good harvest. The harvested produce is sold locally. Elvin works hard to maintain some savings and expand his agricultural business. 

He has requested a loan to purchase plastic greenhouse sheeting and wood. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. He confronts challenges such as changes in the weather so that he can provide quality products for his customers. This investment will increase his income and Elvin will reinvest in his agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. With the increased profit, Elvin will improve the living conditions of his family. He awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase plastic greenhouse sheeting and wood

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Heba prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Heba is a 29-year-old married woman who supports 2 family members from Al Ruseifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for home improvements. She wants to do maintenance on the home and she would like to buy new furniture. In the future she hopes to improve her living standard. 
Since Heba is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 36, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 12 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 26-year-old married man. He has 2 children, aged 2 and 9. He describes himself to be honest and customer friendly. He operates a barber shop.   He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a business area and his primary customers are regular customers from the area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business . He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy electric razor to increase his hair cut services offering. His business goal is to start a new business of a electronics retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve both businesses. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy an electric razor

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, 41, is married to Isabelin. They have two children and they live in the town of Likoni. Brenda has had a business where she sells assorted articles of clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants,blouses, etc. Thanks to her sacrifice, she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase towards the end of the year and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with both quality and variety of clothes. Brenda will purchase more bales of clothes to sell. She says that she sells door to door and from her home.

loans.use: purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Neidys

texts.es: Neidys tiene 32 años y desde hace un año inicio su negocio, con dos planes de llamadas a celulares post pagos y muchos deseos de prosperar. Su meta era lograr  obtener ingresos adicionales, que beneficiaran a su hogar, pero desde su domicilio, hoy ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio y  maneja cinco equipos celulares, además de vender  pasabocas y dulces que generan otros ingresos en su consumo; así mismo también presta el servicio de fotocopias de documentos, actividades que combina perfectamente y en las que tiene plasmada todas sus metas de crecimiento. Su sueño de prosperidad es mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda y con ello sus ingresos, para poder lograrlo poco a poco;  su negocio maneja  en su Indicadores Financieros,  una utilidad neta del 23%, desde la cual proyectamos su exitosos crecimiento gradual, con la inversión de credikiva   pues con ella logrará  adquirir dos nuevos planes post pagos de operadores a celulares, pues   los planes que tiene actualmente resultan ser insuficientes, con relación a la demanda de su mercado..
texts.en: Neidy is 24 years old. She began her business a year ago. She represents two types of pay later cellular phone businesses. She has a great desire to succeed. Her goal is to obtain additional income in order to renovate her home. Her home needs to improve along with her business. In the future she would like to represent five cellular phone companies. She also sells snacks and sweets, which generate additional income for her. She also has a photocopy machine that can copy documents. All these activities work well together. They go along with her goal to grow her business. Her dream is to improve her housing conditions and also her business. Little by little her business reaches her financial goals, growing 23%. She projects a gradual successful growth of her business with the investment from KIVA. She will gain two new cellular companies that have after-use payment plans, as the cellular plans she currently provides are insufficient in relation to the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to acquire two new pay later cellular phone plans for her business.

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buanerge, está decidido por continuar trabajando con la ayuda de prestamos para el cultivo agrícola, en cada temporada necesita el apoyo para comprarse los materiales como el abono y los herbicidas, que son muy importantes para fortalecer la siembra de maíz y frijol, con este nuevo préstamo espera realizar dicha labor de manera que pueda tener resultados efectivos.

Él nos comenta que con los préstamos que ha obtenido ha realizado unos cultivos de mucho provecho, ya que ha recibido buenas cosechas para poder vender la alimentación a su familia y realizar algunas ventas.
texts.en:
Buanerge has decided to continue working with the help of loans for agricultural cultivation. In each season he needs support to purchase materials, such as fertilizer and herbicides, that are very important to strengthen the planting of corn and beans. With this new loan, he hopes to perform this work in a manner that will have effective results.

He tells us that with the loans, he has achieved the obtainment of some very high-return crops. Since he has received good harvests he has been able to sell the food for his family and make some sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Belhengpah Group

texts.en: The lady raising her right hand in the picture is Lhingneichin, who is 36 years old. Her husband is a carpenter and works in house construction. They have two sons and a daughter. Both Lhingneichin and her husband are hard workers.They committed themselves to send their children to school, which they were deprived off in their own childhood because of acute poverty. In 2009, Lhingneichin took a loan from WSDS and started ginger farming because there was high demand in the market and less supply as very few farmers are engaged in ginger cultivation. She not only cultivates ginger, but also sells it by herself in the local market. Its profitability and high demand encourages her to scale up and increase her production. She, therefore, decided to expand the area of her ginger cultivation. For this reason, she wants to hire some laborers and purchase fertilizers and pesticide, which requires capital. She is now asking for a loan for her ginger farming business.

loans.use: To hire laborers and purchase fertilizers and pesticide

loans.name: Sohlhupah Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the end with her hand raised is Nemboi.She is 49 years old, married and has three daughters. Her husband works in a quarry on the river bank and sells stones, shingles and sand to builders. She is one of the beneficiaries of a WSDS loan. With the loan from WSDS, she started weaving (backstrap, traditional style of weaving) local traditional clothes. She, along with her elder daughter who is a school dropout, manages to weave seven to eight saipikhup (a very popular, must have traditional shawl) in a month. This means they hardly enjoy any free moments. To finish seven to eight saipikhup in a month requires one to continuously weave from morning to dusk with little breaks in between.
 
Nemboi is fully committed and engrossed in her work because she wishes to earn as much as she can so that she is in a better position to enroll her youngest daughter in a nursing course. She wants to take a loan of INR 10,000 to purchase yarn/thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase yarn/thread for weaving

loans.name: Vaopah Group

texts.en: Chongneilhing (the lady raising her hand in the picture), 38 years of age, is blessed with four sons and lives in Motbung. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The income from her husband is just enough to meet the household expenditures but it is difficult to enroll her children in a good educational institution. She wants to give the best education available to her children and is willing to do any work to fulfill this dream. In 2009, she along with her four likeminded friends, formed Vaopah group and took a loan from WSDS. With the loan, she started a poultry farm and earned extra income for the family. From her earnings, she is able to pay off her children's school fees and meet the household day-to-day requirements. She plans to expand her poultry farm by adding more chickens. In addition to her poultry farm, she wants to start weaving in her spare time to generate more income. She is now asking for a loan of INR 10,000 to purchase many more chicks for her poutry business and yarn/thread for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Surgir Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Surgir con Esperanza” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; comerciantes ambulantes, venta de ensaladas, venta de pescado, amasandería, juguetes, venta de huevos, venta de papel higiénico. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Teresa presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café y en sus piernas lleva una frazada de colores celeste y amarillo, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de confitería en su hogar y además  trabaja en un club deportivo como encargada, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja de martes a domingo, el lunes lo dedica a su hogar, ubica su  negocio en su casa donde vende diferentes artículos para el hogar y confitería, y en el club vende artículos de juegos como pelotas de ping pong, tacos para las mesas de pool, todo lo que sea diversión dentro del club.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando como en confitería compra en diferentes distribuidoras y supermercados y  los insumos para el club compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará confites y artículos de entretención para el club deportivo.
Una de las metas de Teresa es quedar a cargo del club deportivo para administrarlo y realizar las ventas de sus artículos tranquilamente, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
Teresa vive junto a su madre y cinco hijos de 18, 17, 15, 8 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son tener una boutique donde pueda vender ropa de calidad y satisfacer a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “”Hope Arises”. It is made up of 19 members that are businesspeople who are dedicated to different types of businesses such as a roving salesperson, a salad vendor, a fish vendor, a vendor of masa (corn dough), a toy salesperson, an egg vendor and a toilet paper salesperson. All the members live in Valparaiso.
Teresa is the president of the community bank. In the photo she is seated in the first row, the person on the left. She is wearing a brown jacket and on her legs she has a blanket that is light blue and yellow. On her hair is a ponytail holder and her hair is light.  She sells household goods and clothes from her home. In addition she has worked at a sports club for the past three years. She works from Tuesday to Sunday. Monday’s she does household chores. Her business is located in her home. In this business she sells home articles and clothes. At the sports club she sells sports items such as ping-pong balls, pool table cues and other items that people use at a sport’s club. The merchandise and goods that she needs, such as the household decorations, she buys from different distributors and from the supermarket. The goods for the club she buys wholesale in Santiago as this benefits her economically.
With this loan she will buy clothing and sports training items for the club. One of her goals is to be an administrator of a sports club. In this way she can sell her items without hassles. In this way she can obtain a better quality of life for her children.
Teresa lives with her mother and five children, ages 18. 17.15, 8 and 6. Her dream for her work is to have a boutique where she sells quality clothes, which will make her customers happy. She is very content and thankful for the opportunity provided by the foundation. She hopes they will allow her to invest in her business. The loan is essential for her business and also for her personal development. From this business she has learned how to organize and distribute her earnings and investments in a better way.
Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers to the northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the location of the legislature in the country. It is the first port of the nation and it has a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as the house of Pablo Neruda, the winner of the Noble Prize.

loans.use: to buy clothing and training items for the sports club.

loans.name: Nhuong

texts.en:
Nhuong, 53, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 30 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, especially food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Stefannie Beatriz

texts.es:
Stefannie tiene 23 años es soltera y no tiene hijos.Comenzo con su negocio porque necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos y tubo la oportunidad de trabajar como vendedora comisionista en Yanbal. 

En la actualidad ella vende productos de maquillaje, perfuma y accesorios de bisutería de la revista Yanbal.El trabajo lo realiza sola y le dedica 4 días a la semana. 

Con el préstamo va comprar mas productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje etc.  Su meta es llegar a ser líder de ventas y tener su propio grupo de ventas ella dice que con con mucha perseverancia paciencia y dedicación lo puede lograr.
texts.en:
Stefannie is 23, single, and has no children. She started her business because she needed to have a source of income, and had the opportunity to work as a commission salesperson at Yanbal. 

Currently she sells makeup products, perfume, and costume jewelry accessories from Yanbal magazine. She works on her own, four days a week.  

With the loan, she is going to buy more Yanbal products such as perfumes, creams, makeup, etc. Her goal is to become a sales leader and have her own sales group. She says that with a great deal of perseverance, patience, and dedication, she can achieve it.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and makeup.

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru: Алла торгует хозяйственныи товарами: крышки, пакеты, средства от коморов, моющие средства, мочалки, хозяйственные сумки, зажигалки, закаточные ключи, салфетки, туалетная бумага, закаточные крышки. Торговая точка расположена в проходном месте, покупательский спрос большой. Кредит понадобился для закупки банок и крышек для консервации овощей и фруктов. Алла пунктуальная и ответственная, кредиты всегда выплачивает вовремя.
texts.en: Alla sells household products: lids, plastic bags, mosquito repellents, cleaning agents, sponges, shopping bags, lighters, can openers, napkins, toilet paper, and lids for preserve jars. Alla's market stall is located near the entrance, and customer demand for her goods is high. She is seeking a loan in order to buy canning jars and lids for fruit and vegetable preserves. Alla is punctual and responsible; she always pays her loans on time.

loans.use: to buy jars and lids for fruit and vegetable preserves

loans.name: Jumber

texts.en:
Jumber is from the Khobi district in West Georgia. He is 39 years old and lives with his wife, Marina, two sons (7 and 12 years old) and his mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension and his wife works at the hospital for mental diseases and gets a monthly salary. The children go to the local school. Jumber runs an animal husbandry business. He has two milk cows, two calves, pigs and a horse. His wife milks the cows and produces cheese products. He also has a plot of land where maize and nuts are grown. In addition, he owns a greenhouse where tomatoes and greens are grown. The family sells their agricultural production in the nearby villages. Jumber works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

He requested a loan to build an additional greenhouse. With this loan, he will purchase building materials and greenhouse cellophane to construct it. Jumber will sow different kinds of vegetables and greens to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, he plans to expand his agricultural business and make it more profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее есть один сын. Татьяна имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Татьяна продает женскую одежду на центральном рынке. У нее большой опят работы и хорошая торговая точка, с большой проходимостью людей.  Татьяна продает качественный товар в большом ассортименте.  Она открытая и ответственная.

Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 на закупку сезонной женской одежды - брюк, пиджаков, свитеров.
texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one son. She has her own business.

Tatyana sells women's clothing at the central market. She has a lot of work experience, and her stall is in an advantageous location that attracts many shoppers. Tatyana sells a wide range of high-quality goods. She is open-hearted and responsible.

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia (UAH) to buy women's clothing for autumn: pants, blazers, and sweaters.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for autumn: pants, blazers, and sweaters

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Compound #3. She is 43 years old and married with four children between the ages of 10 and 26 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past five years, she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, and other items in the local market. One problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper and other items for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper and other items to sell

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana, continúa trabajando en su tienda de productos domésticos, ha considerado la necesidad de volver a realizar una inversión en productos para la tienda, por eso solicita nuevamente el financiamiento a través de kiva, para realizar la compra de productos como cereales, boquitas, chorizos, producto de uso personal, lociones, calzado, tintes para el cabello, estos son algunos de los productos que ella comprará con los fondos prestados.

Ella manifiesta que su negocio ha tenido una buena estabilidad en las ventas, ha logrado vender un buen margen con sus clientes, ha cubierto sus gastos del hogar y pago el préstamos a través del buen funcionamiento e ingresos que ha tenido a su hogar, está satisfecha porque ha mejorado su situación económica y por qué junto a Su familia tienen el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Ana continues to work in her store selling domestic products. She has considered the need to make another investment in merchandise for the store. For this reason, Ana is asking for a new loan through Kiva in order to buy more merchandise such as cereals, snacks, sausages, and personal use products like lotions, shoes, and hair dyes. These are just some of the products she will buy with the borrowed funds. 

She says that her business has had good stability in sales. Ana has succeeded in selling a good margin with her clients, has covered household expenses and paid back her loan because of the good functioning and income that she has had at home. This makes her happy because her economic situation has improved and because together with her family they have their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy cereals, snacks, sausage, and personal use products

loans.name: Todos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Todos Juntos” está conformado por  18 emprendedores quienes se dedican diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de lentes, bisutería, venta de dulces, venta de cosméticos, venta de tazones, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Gloria integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una blusa de color lila, un pañuelo de color gris, su cabello es largo y lo usa suelto, es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y venta de jugos naturales, lentes de sol y articulos varios, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo, su horario es de 10ºº a 21ºº horas, se ubica en diferentes galerías y en ferias para ofrecer sus productos.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su bazar la compra en la Ciudad de Santiago y los productos naturales los encarga a Perú y otras veces de Colombia.
Con el crédito comprará productos naturales como yerbas para el colon, adelgazantes, baba de caracol, yerbas para la gastritis, todo tipo de yerbas para la salud.
Una de las metas de Gloria es tener un local establecido donde pueda vender sus productos con tranquilidad, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos.
Gloria vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijos de 28, 15, 16 y 10 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal son poder viajar a Canadá, y a nivel laboral trabajar y tener  todo tipo de mercadería natural en su negocio, así  darles a sus hijos un buen pasar.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le ha servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
The communal bank Todos Juntos [All Together] is made up of 18 entrepreneurs that make a living in various industries, including selling clothes, glasses, costume jewellery, sweets, cosmetics, and bowls, among other services. All of the group members come from the city of Valparaíso.

Gloria is one member of the communal bank. In the photo, she is seated in the first seat of the second row when looking at the photo from left to right. She is wearing a lilac coloured blouse and a gray scarf. She has long, dark brown hair that is loosely tied. Gloria has made a living selling natural products and juices, sunglasses and various other things for the last 9 years. She says that she works Monday to Sunday from 10 AM to 9 PM selling her products in various galleries and fairs. She buys the merchandise she needs for her bazaar from Santiago and orders her natural products from Peru and sometimes Colombia.  With this loan, she will buy natural products like herbs for the colon and for slimming; snail slime; herbs for gastritis; and all other kinds of herbs for improving health. One of Gloria's goals is to have a local establishment where she can sell her products peacefully, and in this way opt for a better quality of life and improve her income. 

Gloria lives together with her spouse and four children aged 28, 15, 16, and 10 all of whom are in school. Her personal dream is to travel to Canada, and her dream for her business is to sell all types of natural products and with her success give her children a good life. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza since they have allowed her to invest in her business. Regarding the communal bank that she is a part of, she says that there is very good communication. In addition, the training has allowed her to learn new sales strategies and accounting.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometres north-east of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the headquarters of the country's legislature. It was the country's first port and has a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, including the house of Nobel Prize-winning poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy natural products like herbs for colon health, slimming and gastritis; snail slime; and all kinds of herbs for health

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a 56-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is teacher and he has been teaching for 29 years. With his meager salary, he has been able to buy 10 acres of land and build a family house. He also practices agriculture in order to supplement his salary despite challenges in unpredictable seasonal weather changes, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and upgrading his studies. Emmy is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Doña Marina es una clienta con 52 años de edad, casada y tiene seis hijos. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores, los cuales estudian. Es una mujer con deseos de superación. Se dedica al comercio de ventas por catálogos porque vió que podía ayudar económicamente sin descuidar a su familia. Tiene cuatro años de experiencia en su negocio y le va bien. Sus ventas las hace a vecinos, familiares, amistades y personas de la misma comunidad. Su meta es vender más para obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios. Así ir mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. El préstamo lo va invertir en comprar mercadería como cosméticos, ropa y accesorios de uso personal.
texts.en: Marina is 52 years old, married, and has six children. She lives with her spouse and two youngest children who are both in school. She is a woman with a desire to succeed who makes a living selling catalogues because she saw that she could help her family economically without neglecting them. She has four years of experience in this business and it's going well. She sells to neighbours, relatives, friends, and people from her community. Marina's goal is to sell more, increase her income, and help her children who are studying. In this way she is improving quality of life for herself and her family. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as cosmetics, clothing, and accessories.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh would like to take a further loan to buy materials to make clothes. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and quality of materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Claudia Marcela

texts.es:
Claudia, administra una tienda de productos básicos en su casa de habitación, vive junto con su esposo administrando el negocio desde hace tres años, además trabaja como encargada de una lotificación de la cual recibe un salario mensual.
Ella realizará una inversión al negocio y solicita un préstamo para poder comprarse la mercadería como aceite, boquitas, graciosas, jugos, galletas, y otros productos que sean de la necesidad para los clientes, su intención es tener un buen inventario de venta y así atraer más a la clientela.
Su proyección en el futuro es tener una mejor solvencia económica a través del negocio, mantener su empleo y vivir en una mejor condición con su familia.
texts.en: Claudia runs a store that sells basic products in her home. She lives with her husband. She has been running the business for three years. She is also in charge of a parcel of land, from which she receives a monthly wage. She will make an investment in her business and she is applying the loan to buy merchandise like oil, snacks, soft drinks, juices, cookies, and other products that her customers need. Her goal is to have a good inventory for sale and that way attract more customers. Her dream in the future is to be better off economically through her business, keep her job, and live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, snacks, soft drinks, juices, and cookies.

loans.name: Proyectando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Proyectando un Futuro” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de masas, chocolatería, encintados para bautizo, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, venta de ensaladas, realización de eventos, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Casablanca, ubicada en la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Sandra integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste chaleco de color gris con rayas, y un pantalones de color gris, botas de color café, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro, en sus manos lleva la carpeta de Fondo Esperanza.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de masa específicamente en empanadas,  desde hace 12 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 17ºº hasta las 20ºº horas, se ubica en la calle a vender sus masas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras de masas y en carnicerías a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará materiales como fuentes, delantal, gorro, aceites, harina, aceitunas, pasas, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Sandra es tener la posibilidad de comprar un carro, ya que de esta manera trabajaría de una forma más cómoda, evitando el frio durante la temporada de invierno y el calor durante la temporada de verano, además darle una buena imagen para su clientela.
Sandra vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 24 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su carro, y a nivel familiar darles un buen pasar a sus hijos, que su hijo menor tenga buenos estudios y su hija mayor una buena atención medica ya que es discapacitada.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto  las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Casablanca es una comuna de la provincia de Valparaíso, ubicada en la región del mismo nombre. Tiene un clima de tipo mediterráneo, con veranos de sequía prolongada y lluvias invernales cortas, pero muy fuertes. El nombre “Casablanca” proviene del siglo XVI cuando existía “una casa de muros blanquecinos“sobre una loma ubicada a un costado de uno de sus caminos más antiguos, llamado camino real de carretas. 
Actualmente su economía se basa en servicios, agricultura, transporte, agroindustria, turismo, comercio.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Proyectando un Futuro" [Projecting the Future] consists of 20 entrepreneurs who are engaged in various areas, among which there are: selling pastries, chocolate store, baptize souvenirs, selling shoes, selling clothes, selling salads, organization of events, and other services. All of them belong to the municipality of Casablanca, located in the city of Valparaiso.

Sandra is a member of the communal bank, and in the picture she is sitting in the front row, ranking first from right to left. She is wearing a gray cardigan with stripes, gray pants, and brown boots. She wears her hair loose, which it's dark brown. She has a Fondo Esperanza folder in her hands. 

She has been dedicated to the area of selling pastries, specifically pies, for 12 years. She says she works Monday to Friday from 5pm to 8pm, when she is on the street selling her pastries. She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in several supermarkets, pastry distribution centers, and low cost butchers, thus economically convenient. 

With the loan, she will buy materials such as bowls, aprons, hats, oils, flour, olives, and raisins to stock her business. One of Sandra's goals is to have the chance to buy a cart, because this way she would work in a more comfortable way, avoiding the cold during the winter and the heat during the summer, as well as to give a good image to her customers.  

Sandra lives with her husband and two children, who are 24 and nine years old. Her dream at a professional level is to have a cart, and at a family level is to give a good life to her children, giving good studies to her youngest son and good medical attention to her oldest daughter, because she is disabled. 

She is very happy and appreciative for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it allowed her to invest in her business. Also, she feels very comfortable with the company of other entrepreneurs in the communal group, because they share various activities. That served her as a moment of entertainment, too. Regarding the trainings given at the meetings, she has learned to manage her business better. 

Casablanca is a commune in the province of Valparaiso, located in the region of the same name. It has a Mediterranean climate, with summers of prolonged drought, and short winter rains, although very strong. The name "Casablanca" comes from the sixteenth century when there was "a house with white walls" on a hill located close to one of its oldest roads, called royal carts' road. Today, its economy is based on services, agriculture, transportation, agribusiness, tourism, and commerce.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bowls, aprons, hats, oils, flour, olives, and raisins to stock her business.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wimana, leader du groupe d’affaire « Espoir », est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et 4 autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est un ancien fonctionnaire passionné (mise en retraite). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché CADECO- Ville. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  13 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pairs de souliers à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à mettre a location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
The client Wimana, leader of the Espoir ("Hope") group, is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and a mother of 10 children who go to school and four others who already own their own homes. Her husband used to be a passionate civil servant ([but] is now on compulsory retirement).

Wimana is a shoe seller. She sets up shop at the market in Cadeco. She has been earning income with this sort of small business for 10 years. 

She has just finished 13 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will serve to provide Wimana 15 pairs of shoes with which to bargain.

Additionally, Wimana hopes to educate her children and build a house. Wimana would like to thank Hekima for its work helping poor women who lack access to formal banking services.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii, 44, is married and has three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood in the city of Mombasa. She started her own food vending business over ten years ago, selling her food stuff from a small stall. The business is located at home and her customers are from the same community.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan she’s requesting to buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and firewood. This loan will help her increase sales and income. Her goal is to provide better customer service so that she can earn higher income and help her family economically and that her business grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy better ingredients and raw food to make soup to sell. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take a further loan to buy more materials to produce advertising signs. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of plastics, papers and materials to print advertising signs.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha would like to take a further loan to buy more sewing materials to increase her production of clothes. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make a greater range and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike is a sixty-four-year old woman from northern Albania. She is married and has four children, all grown-ups. Livestock is the main activity for residents of her region and this includes Mrike. For the past nine years she has been selling dairy and baby calves and practicing animal husbandry of cows, pigs and chickens.

Two months ago, Mrike’s cow unfortunately died and she wants to replace it now with another milk cow with a calf, if possible. This is the reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, hoping that she will find some understanding and financial support from lenders.  

She is being told that others in similar cases have received tremendous help from lenders from around the world and she remains optimistic that she will receive the same.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow with a baby calf.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 62 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 25 years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases for maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. She wishes to invest the profits from her farming in the business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows her very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs in her maize production.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 51 years old and is well-known for her strength of character, commitment to her work, and for helping her daughter to get ahead. She and her family live in the town of Likoni, in the Coast province. 

Saumu works from home, making blouses. This is the first loan she has sought from Yehu, and she plans to use the money to buy fabric and thread so she can expand her business. She wants to make blouses, shirts, and skirts as she has very good customers and wishes to serve them even better. In this way she will earn a good living and will be able to continue supporting her daughter through school.

Her dream is to see her daughter prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 37 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 13 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and purchase fertilizer for his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows him very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs in his maize production.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en: Safa is a 34-year-old single female from Al Nasser, Amman in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to buy a sewing machine. In the future she wants to have a better machine, and improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ceita

texts.en:
Ceita is 28 years old and lives in compound #3 with her husband and three children. Her children are in school and are aged between five and eleven. She says she stopped her education in the 6th grade. 

For the past six years now she has been selling candies, biscuits, rice etc. in the local market. One problem she faces is that when she has shortages of some items on her market table, she doesn't have enough income to buy a huge quantity of goods. She is requesting a loan to buy huge quantity of goods including candies, biscuits, rice etc. for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a huge quantity of goods including candies, biscuits and rice for her business.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, 38, is a married mother of five school-going children. She lives in her own home in the town of Likoni that has both electricity and piped water. She started her own business three years ago. She sells breakfasts, lunches and dinners. The business is located in her home where she has a stall. 

She wants to continue working, which is why she’s asking for a 20,000 KES loan to buy ingredients like meat, flour, vegetables, sugar, rice, beans, oil, etc., which she needs for her food preparation. She will be able to cover her business’ daily demand this way. Her goal is to make the business grow and to see her children graduate. She thanks you in advance for the support you are giving her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, vegetables, sugar, rice, beans and oil.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 43-year-old woman who lives in Compound #3. She stopped her education in the first grade. She is married, with six children between the ages of 18 and 29. All of her children live at home with her and three attend school. Kumba's husband is a tipper. She has been selling palm oil for five years. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the time she makes a profit and she uses it to sustain her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu, 40, lives in Kakata, with her husband and two children that are between the ages of 16 and 20. She has a table in the market where she has been selling lappers (local cloth) for the past four years. She started with a little amount of money that she received from her husband, and now she is proud of her business, because with the profit generated from the business she has bought more goods to improve the business, and is able to help her husband with the home costs. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (local cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Mayadah

texts.en: Mayadah is a 31-year-old single female from Al Nasser, Amman in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD loan to purchase houseware tools to retail. In the future she would like to have her own shop, and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase houseware to retail.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 29 years old and lives in Compound #3. She did not go to school. She is married and has three children between one and 14 years old. They live at home and two attend school. Her husband is a businessman. For the past eight years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. She says she likes how fast her business goes, but the problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her warehouse and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Thiet's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs for his maize production.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim would like to take another loan to buy materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs to sell from her shop. Tim's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beverages and a range of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old, married and has two children. He does crop farming to earn a living. He also does bee-keeping for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills.

Felix hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Madinah has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetics like body lotions and hair extensions. It will help Madinah to generate greater profits and support her family with basic needs. Madinah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Madinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics like body lotions and hair extenstions.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel, age 22, lives in Kakata. She is single and has a 2-year-old child. She stopped her education in the sixth grade. She would like to give the best of education to her child, but she lacks financial support. 

For the past three years, Maybel has been selling peppers, rice, onions, tomatoes, Vita and palm oil in the market. She is very proud of her business because she feels independent. She makes a profit when she sells her goods. With the profit, she buys goods to increase the business and attend to the needs of her child.  

Maybel is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, onions, peppers, Vita and tomatoes for the business. Her plan is to give her child a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, peppers, Vita and tomatoes for the  business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is an enterprising woman who has been able to manage several businesses, including rental houses and a tailoring business. Now she has established a water-vending and juice-selling business. 

Rehema thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support she is receiving, this being her fourth loan from Yehu and second from Kiva. With the loan, she will be able to renovate rooms for her rental houses. Her dream is to be a well-known businesswoman.

loans.use: to renovate rooms for her rental houses.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three grown up children; only one is still in school He owns a retail shop that he has been operating for twenty-two years. He works in the busiest market in Kenya, receiving much produce daily which needs packaging after each sale.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and purchasing stock. 

Danson is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy packaging materials like paper bags, cartons, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay for school fees. His future plan is to open another stall.

loans.use: To buy packaging materials like paper bags and cartons.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Compound #3. She is 49 years old, and did not go to school. She is married with three children between the ages of six and 28. One is living on her own, while the two younger ones are attending school and living at home.

She has been selling dried and fresh fish for five years now. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business. She faced problems during the rainy season and her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs of her maize production.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 29 years old, married and has four children. She is very talented in crafts and she uses the skill to make hand bags, bangles and necklaces to earn a living. She has been earning a living from this business for four years. She employs three people in the business.

Zipporah hopes to expand the business in the future so as to generate more income. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy beads, fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy materials such as beads, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara lives in Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children; two of whom are in school. She owns a green grocer which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Sara sells greens, flour, cooking oil etc. 

Sara learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and seasonal weather. 

Sara is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to expand to a wholesale grocery and a supplier.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows him very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 47 años y tiene 21 años de experiencia en su  negocio de confecciones, su idea de negocio nació cuando aprendió con su tío este oficio hace 21 años;  después de eso trabajó en una recicladora durante 9 años y una vez se quedo sin empleo y con la liquidación, compró tres máquinas y no conforme con ello, decidió  tecnificar su trabajo, para lo cual empezó a estudiar en el Servivcio Nacional de Aprendizaje, escalado y patronaje; En la actualidad sus principales productos son  las bermudas, jeans, ropa deportiva, los cuales  vende a  clientes particulares, vecinos; en su taller se desarrollan todas las operaciones del oficio es decir  corte, costura, acabado, planchado, empacado, vendiéndolo a crédito, y diariamente; sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes de tela en el centro de la ciudad  de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y accesorios en general, para la confección, así mejorará su negocio con esta inversión, porque logrará cumplir con los pedidos con los cuales fabricará  ropa de damas, caballeros e infantil, porque necesita  mantener existencia de productos  para la temporada de amor y amistad,que se acerca y en la cual impactará a su clientela.  
La inversión de su credikiva, mejorará su respuesta a los pedidos  y aumentará su volumen de ventas; su meta  mas adelante es tener un punto de venta y adquirir un lote propio, para construir su vivienda, pero su desafío  para el logro de su propósito es la falta de capital para invertir.


invertiría su crédito en ropa de dama, caballero y niño, telas hilos, botones, cierres, y accesorios en general para la confección
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and she has 21 years experience in her dressmaking business. The idea for her business was born when she learned this skill with her uncle 21 years ago. After this she worked in a recycling company for 9 years and when she was left unemployed, she used her severance pay to purchase three machines but she wasn’t satisfied with that. She then decided to make her work more technical so she began to study scales and patterns at The National Learning Service. At the moment her main products are Bermuda shorts, jeans and sports clothes which she sells to private customers and neighbors. She carries out all the activities of her trade in her workshop, such as cutting, sewing, finishing, ironing and packing and she sells everyday on credit. She makes her purchases in cash in fabric stores in Barranquilla city center. She is currently applying for a credikiva (her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) with which she will purchase fabric, threads, buttons, zips and general accessories for dressmaking. This investment will help her to improve her business because she will be able to fulfill her orders and manufacture women’s, men’s and children’s clothes. She needs to maintain stock for Love and Friendship day which is upcoming and will impact her customer base. Her credikiva investment will improve her response to orders and increase her sales. Her future goal is to have a sales outlet and to purchase her own lot to build her house but the lack of money to invest in it presents her with a challenge.

She will invest her loan in women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, fabric, thread, buttons, zips and general dressmaking accessories.

loans.use: to purchase women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, fabric, thread, buttons, zips and general dressmaking accessories.

loans.name: Onide Roberto

texts.es:
ONIDE ROBERTO tiene 46 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ONIDE ROBERTO se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar ranger, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos. 

Con la yuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para trabajar en los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar una finca para tener seguro donde trabajar.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo el cogollero  y el ratón. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
ONIDE ROBERTO is 46 years old and in a common law marriage. He has 6 children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the Bendición de Dios communal bank. It is located in the community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche priah. They work in farming and fishing.

ONIDE ROBERTO grows corn and rice and raises animals. He is asking for the loan to buy herbicides, urea, insecticide, and fertilizers.With the help of the loan, he can buy what he needs to work on the crops. He will make thepurchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy a farm to have a stable place to work. 

The challenges he faces are pests, such as budworm and mice. In his free time, he likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, urea, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 44 años, es viuda desde hace un tiempo, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Encarnación. La señora Ana es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene un local en el Circuito Comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación en donde comercializa relojes, ropas, bijouteries y otros artículos. Además tiene habitaciones en alquiler en su casa lo que le ayuda con otros ingresos. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de relojes, ropas, bijouteries y otros con lo que podrá surtir su local y de esa forma atraer a más clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She has been a widow for some time. She has three children and lives in the city of  Encarnación. Ana has been a merchant for several years. She has a locale in the commercial area of the city of Encarnación where she sells watches, clothes, jewelry and other items. She also rents out rooms in her house, which brings in more income. Thanks to these activities, she has been able to get ahead, support her home and pay for any unexpected expenses.

She has asked for this loan to by watches, clothes, jewelry and more to stock her locale and in this way attract more customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given, because it will really be helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy watches, jewelry and more.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry fish. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Jackmix

texts.en:
Jackmix is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and owns a barber shop which has been in operation for eight years; he began the business from the savings he had made over a long period of time.

Jackmix is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase shavers and other business equipment. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Although the business faces the challenge of high cost of purchasing equipment, Jackmix believes that the addition of these new machines will help improve his sales.

His ambition is to open other barber shops and to purchase a three-wheel vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase shavers and other business equipment.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Edgardo compró materias primas e insumos como cuero, capelladas, adornos con los cuales fabricó nuevos diseños de calzados que vendió oportunamente En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues investigó que en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, caracterizada por la calidaden calzados y productos de cuero, estan los mejores proveedores de pedreria y cuero, pero requiere tener mas capital de trabajo para comprar todos los insumos y materiales que requiere para mejorar aun mas su acabado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un creidkiva, inversión que resultará exitosa en el marco de que con ella potencializará un mercado menos doméstico, con el que  proyecta  el ncremento de sus ventas , especialmente para el segundo semestre del año, donde usualmente ocurren los picos de incremento.
texts.en: Edgardo used his previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as leather, shoe uppers and decorative materials with which he made new footwear designs that he duly sold.  He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan as he has found the best suppliers of decorative stones and leather in Bucaramanga, a city known for the quality of its footwear and leather products, but needs more working capital in order to be able to buy all the supplies and materials that he needs to further improve the quality of his goods.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.  His investment will be successful as he will be able to use it to boost sales to a wider market.  He plans to increase his sales, especially during the second half of the year which is usually his peak sales period.

loans.use: to buy decorative stones and leather

loans.name: Landouard

texts.en:
Landouard is 48 years old, married, and has eight children. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production. He needs the fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he plans to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire farm machinery that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
María  tiene 42 años es soltera no tiene hijos. La familia de María siempre  han incursionado en el negocio de las ventas de comidas. María ha sido dedicada desde muy pequeña para tener sus propias cosas por eso ella comenzo con su propio negocio de venta de comida. 

Comenzando a trabajar con su familia, empezó  ahorrar dinero con la idea de algún día instalar su propio negocio entonces se le presento la oportunidad de tener su negocio ahora ya tiene 2 años que se independizo y le va muy bien en su restaurante. 

El trabajo lo hace sola y el horario es de 9:00 am 11 pm. Con el prestamo quiere comprar pollos y herramientas para cocinar. 
Su Meta de María es tener su restaurante ella desea darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  Her family have always been in the food business.  María has been in this line of work since she was very young.  She started her own food business so that she could have her own things.

María started working with her family and saved money so that she could one day open her own business.  Then, the opportunity to own her own business presented itself.  She has been working for herself for two years and her restaurant is doing very well.

María works alone, from 9.00am to 11.00pm.  She would like to use this loan to buy chickens and cooking utensils.  Her goal is to keep running her restaurant.  She would like to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cooking utensils

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano es casado y padre de dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de el uno de ellos estudia la educación secundaria y el otro la media superior ambos en  escuelas públicas de la localidad, el trabaja como encargado de una carnicería desde hace casi cinco años y con ese trabaja poco a poco ha ido construyendo un patrimonio para él y su familia la casa que ellos habitan ha ido sufriendo deterioros con el tiempo y quiere enjarrar su casa por fuera y pintarla es por ello que solicita el apoyo para la remodelación de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mariano is married and the father of two children who are still financially dependent on him.  One is attending a local public middle school and the other is in high school.  Mariano has been working as a manager in a butcher's shop for five years.  Through his work, he has gradually been building wealth for himself and his family.  The house in which they live has been deteriorating over time and he would like to plaster and paint the outside.  He is requesting support to fix up his house.

loans.use: to plaster and paint his house

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor es casado y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 12 años y trabaja como vendedor de periódico en  una avenida principal de la localidad el tiene ya casi nueve años dedicando a esta actividad y siempre se ha preocupado por tener un patrimonio seguro y cálido para cuando él y su esposa lleguen a la vejez; el tiene un sueño y por el cual está solicitando el apoyo: quiere ampliar la sala de su casa quitando la pared de un cuarto y pódelo hacer sala; él se ve en unos 15 años sentado en su sala leyendo el periódico y sus nietos corriendo por ella.
texts.en: Héctor is married and has been living in a government-subsidized house for 12 years.  He works as a newspaper seller in one of the main avenues in his town.  He has been in this job for nearly nine years and has always worked hard to build up a secure nest egg for when he and his wife reach old age.  He has a dream for which he is requesting this loan.  He would like to extend his living room, getting rid of a wall.  Héctor sees himself in 15 years time, sitting in his living room, reading the newspaper, with his grandchildren running around him.

loans.use: to extend his living room

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 36, is living together with her friend and three children at Kakata. The children are between the ages of 5 and 18.
