She is applying to Vision Fund for a loan to buy a multi-purpose printer that can scan and make color copies, since she already has a black-and-white printer. Having this printer will add business. She also wants to buy cartridges for her other printer, CDs to burn, white paper, pencils, and so forth. She dreams of having more computers because at times her customers get tired of waiting for one and she loses the business. She believes that the investment will turn out well because she wants to work hard and get ahead.

The other eight members are Rosalba, Francisca, Rosario, María Elisa, María de Lourdes, Juan José, Elizabeth, and José Luis. They will purchase items and supplies for their businesses: a school cooperative; sales of sweets and candies; auto spare parts store; costume jewelry sales; small appliance repair; homemade corn tortillas sales; and an ironworks shop.

loans.use: to buy a mulit-purpose printer and supplies for an Internet cafe.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru:
Зафарчон житель города Худжанд. Ему 24 года. Он женат. Живет с родителями. Его брат вместе с женой находится в Российской Федерации. Жена Зафарчона домохозяйка. Она также занимается растениеводством. Младший брат Зафарчона работает таксистом, он получает хорошую прибыль. 
Зафарчон занимается животноводством. Он на протяжении семи лет зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Зафарчон закупает скот, разводит и через несколько месяцев продает. 
Зафарчон просит кредит для закупа коров и бычков.
texts.en:
Zafarjon lives in Khujand. He is 24 and married. Zafarjon lives with his parents. His brother and sister-in-law are currently in Russia.
Zafarjon's wife stays at home. She also raises crops. Zafarjon's younger brother is a taxi driver who makes good money.
Zafarjon raises animals. He's been earning his living by raising cattle for 7 years. Zafarjon buys livestock, raises it, and sells it after a few months. He has requested a loan to buy cows and bulls.

loans.use: to buy cows and bulls

loans.name: Tsetsegbayar

texts.en:
Tsetsegbayar is 28 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Erdenehuu, and he is 29 years old. Her daughter has started to go to school. 

She started her own beauty products trade business with working capital of MNT 500,000. She has increased this account to MNT 1,100,000. She is well-experienced in this beauty products trading.  Her customers appreciate her as a hardworking and quiet woman. Now her business is sustainable, and she has many regular customers. 

She is requesting a MNT 1,200,000 loan to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Antonia Luisa

texts.es:
Antonia, está satisfecha por trabajar con microcréditos, está solicitando nuevamente el servicio ya que desea comprarse los materiales necesarios para el negocio como lo es él maíz, chicharrón, aceite, leña, gas, quesillo, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros productos, esto le permitirá a Antonia seguir produciendo pupusas, teniendo todo lo necesario para su trabajo.
Ella manifiesta que con la inversión del crédito anterior, tuvo una experiencia positiva, logrando tener lo necesario para poder trabajar, sus ventas han sido estables, las circunstancias familiares han sido mejor, no ha tenido inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Antonia is satisfied working with micro loans.  She’s once again asking for the service because she wants to buy the materials necessary for her business like corn, fried pork, oil, firewood, gas, string cheese, soft-drinks and juices, among other products.  This will make it possible for Antonia to continue making ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corncakes] having everything she needs on hand for her work.

She states that she had a positive experience with the previous loan because she was able to have everything she needed to work on hand.  Her sales have been stable and her family situation has improved; she’s had no problems.

loans.use: to buy corn, fried pork, oil, firewood, gas, string cheese and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José, está decidido por un nuevo préstamo, quiere comprarse más mercadería para el negocio, comprando al por mayor el maíz y frijol que son de mucha demanda, para él estos préstamos son la ayuda que le permite poder realizar comercio.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior tuvo una buena experiencia, ya que logro tener buenas ventas, por esta situación es que continuara trabajando con préstamos, tiene una mejor solvencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
José has decided on a new loan; he wants to buy merchandise for the business.  He will buy corn and beans at wholesale because they are in high demand.  For him, these loans are the help that makes it possible for him to be a merchant.  

He states that he had a positive experience with the previous loan in that he had good sales and this is why he will continue working with loans; his business is more solvent.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru:
Асель  38 лет, воспитывает 4-летнюю дочку. Асель в качестве основного дохода для ее маленькой семьи, с 2002 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания и мыломоющими средствами, начав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Асель, на сегодняшний  день у нее имеется 2 торговых места, ежемесячный доход составляет около 30,000 сом. Доходы от бизнеса позволяют Асель откладывать сумму на хорошее обучение дочери. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асель обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп партии сахара, макарон, чая и порошков.  Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса посредством покупки контейнера.
texts.en:
Asel is 38 years old. She is raising a 4-year-old daughter. Since 2002 Asel  has been selling food and detergents as a primary source of income for her small family. She started this business with 30,000 KGS. Thanks to Asel's hard work, she currently has two points of sale. Her monthly income is around 30,000 KGS. The income from her business lets Asel save up for her daughter's education.
To develop her business further, Asel has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy a batch of sugar, macaroni, tea, and detergents. Asel plans to invest the income from the loan into growing her business by buying a container.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, macaroni, tea, and detergents for resale

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela is 19 years old and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes, and German-style buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to get all the equipment for her business. In the future, Rasela hopes to earn more to help her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar, a new frying pan, and other equipment for her new business

loans.name: Maria Bartola

texts.es:
María, continua con su negocio en el mercado, ofreciendo a los clientes mango, tamarindo, jocotes,y otros tipo de frutas, actualmente se ha quedado sin recursos para poder reinvertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo financiamiento para poder comprarse frutas frescas como sandia, mangos, jocote, esto ayudara a que pueda tener abastecido el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo una experiencia positiva que le permitió tener las frutas frescas para ofrecer a los clientes, trabajando con entusiasmo para mejorar los ingresos, viviendo en mejor condición.
texts.en:
María continues with her business in the market selling mango, tamarind, Spanish plum and other types of fruit to her customers.  She’s currently run out of resources to be able to invest in the business which is why she’s asking for a new loan to buy fresh fruit like watermelon, mangoes and Spanish plum; this will help her keep the business well-stocked.

She had a positive experience with the previous loan which made it possible for her to have fresh fruit to offer her customers working enthusiastically to improve income and living under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, mangoes and Spanish plums.

loans.name: Heisemberg Isael

texts.es:
Heisemberg, vive con su familia, su esposa, dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad, él es agricultor, su familia depende de él, su trabajo son las pipianeras, las cuales cultiva y a diario supervisa, la ventaja es que las tierras son propias y le queda ganancias de la venta de la cosecha.
Él solicita un crédito para la compra de un carretón con caballo, para poder sacar la cosecha del terreno donde cultiva, este crédito le ayudara a facilitarle mas el trabajo, ahorrándose transporte del producto.
Los sueños de Heisemberg es superarse con un vehiculo, ya que al comprarlo estaría sustituyéndolo para poder transportar en él la cosecha.
texts.en:
Heisemberg lives with his family consisting of his wife and two children who are 4 and 5 years old.  He’s a farmer.  His family depends on him.  His work is growing pumpkins; he cares for them daily.  The advantage is that his land is apt for them and selling his crops produces profits for him.

He’s requesting a loan to buy a horse-drawn wagon to transport the harvest from the growing field.  This loan will help him make his work easier and will save transportation costs.  Heisemberg’s dream is to improve with a vehicle because by purchasing it he will be substituting it to transport his crops in it.

loans.use: to buy a horse-drawn cart and a horse.

loans.name: Nicolette Eléonore

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Eléonore est mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés. Elle vend des sacs de charbons, des bidons de Pétrole et les cartes de recharges de tout réseaux confondu depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de maximiser son profit, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un concours financier auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: 44 years old, Eléonore is married and the mother of five school aged children.  She sells bags of charcoal, cans of petrol, and prepaid mobile cards for all networks.  For several years she has gotten her supplies in one of the markets in Benin.  In order to increase her working capital and maximize profit, she requested and received financial assistance from Finadev. This loan will allow her to respond to the demands of her customers and contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, cans of petrol, and prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 8 and 19.

Samuel has a quarrying business whereby he has been supplying stones to construction sites for the past nine years, and has a good income. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more modern tools to be used on his quarry site.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more modern tools to be used on the quarry site.

loans.name: Flor De Luna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  está conformado  de tres señoras quien cada una  vive en diferente barrio, son originarias de un pueblo llamado Tecpatan. En la que celebran la fiesta de  san macos el 25 de  abril que es la fiesta más  grande del pueblo.
 
   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Aida, quien es casada con el señor  Gustavo y con quien procreo un hijo que en esta a su responsabilidad y se llama Gustavo Alonso  de la edad de trece años.
 
   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos en donde lleva trabajando poco tiempo y comenta que le va bien ya que está viendo un mejor resultado.

   Ella inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a sus esos con los ingresos de su hogar como bien apoyara a su hijo quien esta estudiando en la preparatoria  y desea que tenga algo lo  mejor en la vida como  sus  estudios.
 
   Comenta que desde muy joven ella trabaja haya que sus padres la enseñaron a trabajar desde muy pequeña y  da gracias a ello por haberla enseñado a ser la persona que es.

     Lo que desea es que como esta pequeña actividad ella, pueda seguir trabajando y con el préstamo poder  seguir adelante con su actividad.

     La señora que conforman el grupo son: Feliciana, invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de mercancía para surtir su negocio  de abarrotes y la señora  Rosario Adriana, invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para su papelería.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three ladies, and each of them lives in a different neighborhood. They come from a village named Tecpatan, where the feast of Saint Mark - the biggest festival of the village - is celebrated on April 25th.
The member who interviewed is called Aida. She's married to Gustavo and they have a son who's under her care. His name is Gustavo Alonso and he's 13 years old.
She requested the loan in order to invest in the purchase of supplies for making tacos. She's been in this line of work for a short amount of time and she reports that it's going well, since she has been getting better results.
She started this business to help her husband with the household income, and also to support her son, who's in high school. She wishes for her son to have the best in life, such as an education.
She reports that she's been working ever since she was very young, because her parents taught her to work at a very young age. She's thankful for that, because they taught her to be the person that she is.
Her wish is that she can keep on working on this small business, and also that with the loan, she can move her business forward.
The ladies who comprise the group are Feliciana, who will use the loan to purchase merchandise in order to stock up her business, and Rosario Adriana, who will use it to purchase school supplies for her stationery store.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tacos.

loans.name: Kholdona

texts.ru: Холдона очень красивая и мотивированная девушка. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она хочет создать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» (To get ahead) организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Kholdona is a beautiful and motivated young woman. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She wants to establish her own business. To that end, she studied in a course called "To Get Ahead," organized by the Association of Businesswomen, for which she earned a certificate. Now Kholdona is fully able to set up her own business and to become successful at it. Because Kholdona is an experienced seamstress, she wants to start a business in this area. 

Kholdona is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine with which to get her business started. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to establish a new business

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala, 39, is an independent and married woman who livies with her family in a remote area of Punjab, Pakistan. Her family consists of her husband, a son, and a daughter. Both of her children are in school. Her husband works in a boutique shop and his monthly income is less than 20,000pkr, which is too low to meet his family's basic needs and to meet household expenses. For the past 3 years, Ghazal has been running a beauty salon which has been very successful. She now needs to purchase some furniture and cosmetic products for the salon.

For that, as a member of a eight-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some furniture (chairs, etc.) and some cosmetic products (lipstick, facial scrubs, beauty kits, etc.) for her beauty salon. 

While running her business, she is also a very good and hardworking housewife. She has to look after both her children as well as her business. Her husband, children, neighbors, and clients always appreciate her hard work. Ghazala's biggest dream of life is to provide a quality education to her children. She is very much thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

Note: In the picture Ghazal holding her passbook while a borrower named Farhat is holding her younger son.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. Pacita, 55, is a widow and with three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of selling coconuts. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns 5,000 per month. In 2011, Pacita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 php which will be used to pay for the cost of farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of farm maintenance

loans.name: Sinoti

texts.en: Sinoti is 19 years old and single. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase equipment for her business, having joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.  In the future, Sinoti hopes to continue her enterprise to contribute to her family's income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, a new freezer, and cups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en: Laarni is 26 years old. He is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Laarni provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. Laarni is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase paint, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase paint, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es: Bertha Margarita de 53 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 33, 20 anos de edad. De los cuales en la actualidad ninguno esta bajo su responsabilidad porque tienen familias propias.  La actividad económica de Bertha Margarita  es taller de serigrafía y servicio de disco móvil, tiene 12 anos de experiencia en el negocio el cual consiste en la elaboración de boinas cintas alusivas, trajes de gala para desfile y marchas. Principalmente en tiempo de las fiestas patrias, graduaciones en los colegios y fin de ano escolar. También los fines de semana presta servicios de amenizacion con el disco móvil en fiestas particulares, actividades en colegios, esa es la rutina diaria de Bertha Margarita la cual se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora responsable  y buena paga en tiempo y forma. Bertha ya ha tenido créditos anteriores. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en la compra de materia prima para realizar los diferentes trabajos que le encargan sus clientes. El material que utiliza es el siguiente; tela, broches, cintas, pintura, madera, plásticos, entre otros. Bertha  Margarita agradece la oportunidad que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un ingreso de vida digno.
texts.en:
Bertha Margarita is a 53 year-old single mother of two children, ages 33 and 20. Neither of them are under her care anymore, as they both have their own families. Bertha Margarita's business consists of a silk screen printing shop and sound system rentals. She has 12 years of business experience, making berets, costume ribbons, and parade regalia, mainly for civic holidays, graduations, and end of school year events. Also, on the weekends she rents out an entertainment sound system for private parties and school functions. That's Bertha Margarita's daily routine, showing her to be a very hard-working and responsible woman who pays her bills on time and reliably. 

Bertha has taken out loans in the past for her business, which is located in her home. She is seeking this loan in order to invest in raw materials to fill the various orders she receives from her customers. The items she uses include fabric, clips, ribbon, ink, wood, and plastics,among others. Bertha Margarita is thankful for the opportunity that Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in materials for her silk screening shop like cloth, clips, ribbon, ink, wood, and plastics.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Doña Marcelina, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro. Hace 3 años que ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas como pastelitos rellenos con carne, baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena de frijoles, huevo, queso, etc.), tajadas con carne, refrescos, agua en bolsa, y golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas y otros. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en una cafetería que está enfrente de la cancha de fútbol, la cual está un poco deteriorada y necesita repararla para darle una mejor imagen y seguridad a su negocio, para eso ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para reparar techo y el  piso.  Tiene como meta seguir mejorando el negocio para tener siempre un ingreso que le ayude a sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marcelina, 45, is married and has four children.  She lives in the town of Santa Rita, Yoro.  She’s had her own business for three years selling fast-food snacks like little meat-filled turnovers, baleadas (corn tortilla filled with beans, eggs, cheese, etc.), fried plantain with meat, soft-drinks, bagged water and snacks like packaged chips, candy, cookies and others.  She has the business set up in a snack bar located across from a soccer field.  It’s a bit deteriorated and she needs to repair it so that it will have better appearance and security for the business and this is why she’s opted for a 10,000 Lempira loan to repair the roof and floor.  Her goal is to continue improving the business so that she will always have a source of income that will help her move her children forward.

loans.use: to repair her snack bar's roof and floor.

loans.name: Fredy Alexander

texts.es:
Fredy, necesita más capital de trabajo para su actividad agrícola, pues está iniciando una nueva siembra de maíz y frijol para esto el necesita recursos económicos que puedan cubrir el gasto en la compra de abono y herbicidas para aplicarlos al cultivo, solicita un crédito en la cual le permite comprarse los materiales y asimismo iniciar un trabajo más ordenado en la siembra.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en sus aplicaciones de abono y herbicidas, ya que logró tener una cosecha bastante considerable, pagó el alquiler del terreno donde realiza el cultivo y hasta el momento se ha mantenido en la producción de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Fredy needs more working capital for his agricultural activity.  He is starting to plant new corn and bean crops.  He needs financial resources for this so that he can cover the cost of buying natural fertilizers and herbicides to apply to the crops.  He is requesting a loan to allow him to buy the materials.  He will then begin planting in a more ordered way.

The previous loan had a positive effect on his applications of natural fertilizers and herbicides.  He managed to have a considerable harvest and paid the rent for the land where he grows his crops.  So far he has maintained his production of corn and beans.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Las Camelinitas Group

texts.es: Trinidad es una mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante ella tiene 25 años de edad y estudio hasta sexto de primaria y ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios por falta de presupuesto ya que sus padres no podían con los gastos de ella ya que son mas hermanos y fue así que comenzaron a aprender sobre el negocio familiar que es la elaboración de ollas y artesanías de barro para poder ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la casa. Dice que sus papas le han enseñado hacer un sinfín de artesanías de diferentes tamaños y modelos y que después de casada ella siguió la tradición y ahora tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 10 años ya que se caso muy chica. Comenta que sale a vender sus creaciones a diferentes tianguis, expo ferias, en poblaciones aledañas a su comunidad y que le va bien con las ventas ya que todo lo hace con mucho cariño y dedicación para que se vendan mas rápido. Ahorita ella  esta pidiendo un crédito a Vision Fund para la compra de varias cosas que ocupa para hacer sus artesanías como tierra (barro) leña para cocer las artesanías, esmalte, pinturas de diferentes colores y muchas cosas mas. Dice que su meta es rentar un local cerca de la carretera para que los turistas vean y le compren sus creaciones y para que ella no salga tan seguido de su casa y estar mas estable y asi cuidar de sus pequeños hijos. Las otras 4 integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Leticia, Maria Fernanda y Guadalupe ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de  frutas y legumbres de temporada, en material para elaborar artesanías en barro.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s 25-years-old and completed sixth grade but was unable to continue with her education because her parents couldn’t afford it; they were unable to cover expenses because she has other siblings so they started to learn the family business which is making pots and clay crafts to help their parents with household expenses.

She says that her parents have taught her how to make an infinite number of crafts in various sizes and styles and once she got married she continued the tradition and now has had her own business for about 10 years since she married very young.

She comments that she heads out to sell her creations in various street markets, expo fairs and in communities adjacent to hers and that she does well with the sales because everything she makes she does with much affection and dedication so that they will sell more quickly.

Right now she’s asking Vision Fund for a loan to buy several things she needs to make her crafts like clay, firewood to fire the crafts, enamel, paint in various colors and many more things.  She says that the goal is to rent a locale near the highway so that tourists will see and buy her creations and she won’t have to leave home so often and she can be more stable and care for her little children.

The other four group members are Araceli, Leticia, María Fernanda and Guadalupe.  They will use their loans to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables and in supplies needed to make clay crafts.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Gustavo

texts.es:
Pedro, siempre está dedicado al transporte de melaza por grandes cantidades, en manifiesta que esta ocupación es la que le ayuda para mantenerse él y también su hogar, nuevamente está acudiendo para solicitar un préstamo que le permita comprarse 8 toneladas de melaza y 50 sacos de maíz, los cuales transporta y distribuye a sus clientes.
Don Pedro manifiesta que el trabajo con créditos le ha permitido mantener en el negocio, lo necesario de productos para distribución, trabajando siempre en su camion de carga, él ha mejorado su condición.
texts.en: Pedro has always worked transporting molasses in large amounts.  He states that this occupation helps him support himself and his home.  He’s once again making a loan request to buy 8 tons of molasses and 50 sacks of corn that he transports and distributes to his customers.  Pedro states that working with loans has made it possible for him to keep the necessary products to distribute in his business always working with a cargo truck; he’s improved his condition.

loans.use: to buy 8 tons of molasses and 50 sacks of corn.

loans.name: Patricia Maricel

texts.es:
Patricia, necesita fortalecer el negocio de más venta de productos de primera necesidad, es por eso que nuevamente nos solicita un crédito para poder invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, maíz, también materia prima para hacerlo refresco como el azúcar y frutas frescas, ya que esto le dará lo necesario para continuar realizando las ventas a sus clientes.
Ella nos comenta que ha trabajado muy bien con estos créditos en el negocio, le han ayudado a realizar la compra de productos para la tienda, su condición por el momento se encuentra mejor que antes, trabaja temporalmente en la alcaldía de la localidad esto le ha dado una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia needs to strengthen her business of selling basic needs products.  That is why she is requesting a loan once again.  She is requesting the loan to be able to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and corn.  She will also use the loan to buy the ingredients like sugar and fresh fruit in order to make drinks.  These will give her what she needs to continue making sales to her customers.  

She tells us that she has worked very well with these loans in her business.  They have helped her to buy products for the store.  At this time her condition is better than before.  

She is working temporarily at the local City Hall.  This has given her a  new source of income for her family.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, corn, and fresh fruit.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 16 años de edad, ambos dependen económicamente de sus padres, María está dedicada al actividades domésticas y agropecuarias, colaborando con su esposo en la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral,lo realiza desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, ya que está pendiente de asistir a la granja en cualquier momento del día, su ventaja con el negocio es que puede disponer de la granja para la alimentación de la familia y se traslada al mercado para realizar venta.

Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de dos cerdos y también materiales como láminas, alambres, madera  para reparar corral, Este crédito ayudará a crear un negocio más rentable que le permita generar más ingresos económico a su familia y dentro de los riesgos que puede presentar el negocio es un virus que afecte la salud de los animales. La aspiración de María con respecto al crédito es realizar una buena inversión, tener estabilidad en la granja y a futuro poder realizar con su familia más oportunidades para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 16, both of whom are economically dependent on their parents. María spends her time on domestic and agricultural work, working with her husband to raise hogs and poultry. She works from six in the morning until four in the afternoon, as the farm requires constant attention throughout the day. The benefit of the business is that she can use the farm to feed her family by going to market to make sales.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy two pigs as well as materials like sheet metal, barbed wire, and wood to maintain her pens. Among the risks to her business is disease that could affect the health of her animals. This loan will help her to develop a more profitable business that will bring in greater income to her family. María's hope with respect to this loan is to make a sound investment, gain stability for her farm and in the future make more opportunities possible for her family so they can do better for themselves.

loans.use: to buy two pigs as well as materials like sheet metal, barbed wire, and wood to maintain her pens.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, está decidida a continuar realizando inversiones a su negocio que le permitan dar una mejor atención a los clientes, solicita un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios como carne de res, leña, un gas, condimentos, ya que éstos los utiliza en el día a día del negocio.

María nos comenta que es a través de estos préstamos, como ella ha ido mejorando su situación económica en el negocio, pues se le ha prestado para comprar mercadería y ha logrado cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y salud en su familia, está agradecida con este servicio del cual espera continuar recibiendo beneficios.
texts.en:
María has opted to continue investing in her business to provide better customer service.  She’s requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies like beef, firewood, a tank of gas and condiments that she uses daily in her business.

María comments that through these loans she’s been improving the economic situation of her business because she’s been lent to in order to buy merchandise and she’s managed to cover her and her family’s food needs.  She’s grateful for this service and hopes to continue receiving its benefits.

loans.use: to buy beef, firewood a tank of gas and condiments.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, está solicitando un préstamo, pues considera que a través de ellos logra mejorar la disponibilidad de mercadería en el negocio, ya que ha tenido la oportunidad con créditos anteriores y es por eso que quiere continuar trabajando; en esta ocasión se comprará variedad de camisas, ropa de cama, pantalones, sombrillas, tela de diferentes colores, entre otros productos que son necesarios para el vestir de los clientes.

Manifiesta que con su experiencia anterior logró realizar una buena inversión de la cual generó ventas adecuadas como para mantener un nivel de ingreso, está agradecido y espera continuar con estos financiamientos para la prosperidad de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is seeking a loan because he believes that it will allow him to improve his business's offering of merchandise. He's had that opportunity with prior loans and so he wants to keep working. This time, he will buy a variety of shirts, pajamas, pants, parasols, and fabric in different colors, among other items that are necessary to meet his customer's clothing needs. 

He attests that in his prior experience, he succeeded in making a good investment that generated enough sales to maintain his level of income. He is grateful and hopes to continue with these loans for the sake of his prosperity and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shirts, pajamas, pants, parasols, and fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, necesita invertir más en el negocio por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito, porque considera que a través de ellos ha logrado tener lo necesario para la elaboración de las tortillas se comprará maíz, leña, gas propano, estos son los materiales que intervienen directamente en el negocio, este crédito le dará nuevamente el recurso económico para que ella pueda fortalecer su inventario de los materiales antes mencionados.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, pues le ayudó a fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias de las ventas ha logrado ayudar a su familia cubriendo los gastos de alimentación, las demás condiciones se mantiene y por el momento no ha atravesado ningún problema.
texts.en:
Juana needs to invest more in the business which is why she’s requesting a new loan; she considers that through them she’s been able to have everything she needs to make tortillas.  She will buy corn, firewood and propane which are supplies that are directly needed for the business.  This loan will give her once again the economic resources to strengthen inventory of the materials mentioned above.

She had a positive effect from the previous loan in that it helped her strengthen the business and with profits from sales she was able to help her family covering food costs.  Her other conditions are stable and for the moment she’s having no problems.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and propane.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y también a la venta de comida, ella cuenta que Finca le ayudó a mantener y aumentar su negocio, también le dio facilidades para que pueda educar a sus hijos, le gustan las capacitaciones que brindan en sus reuniones porque le ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida. Emilia solicita un préstamo para aumentar el stock en su negocio. El sueño de Emilia es aprender a manejar una computadora.
texts.en: Emilia makes a living selling spare motorbike parts and also selling food. She states that FINCA helped her maintain and grow her business, and also gave her the facilities to be able to educate her children. She likes the training they offer in their meetings because they help her improve her quality of life. Emilia is requesting a loan to grow her business' stock. Emilia's dream is to learn to operate a computer.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to sell in her business.

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona de los Angeles , de 28 años de edad  casada con tres hijos, Petrona es de la localidad de paz centro lugar del occidene del pais  que se caracteriza por ser un zona productiva en la elaracion de ladrillos y productos artesanales y tambien se caracteriza por las comidas tipicas como es el quesillos de nicaragua. una comida muy tipica , muy sabrosa la cual se  elabora de la siguiente forma: una tortilla enbuelta con queso quesillo, repollo picado, cebolla, chile, crema. Petrona tiene por negocio la venta de quesillos la cual ofrece de forma ambulante en diferentes ciudades y centros universitarios ya que para los jovenes ademas de ser un comida tipica sobrosa es una comida rapida que pueden comprar para sequir adelante en el trasncurso del dia. El financiamieno lo quiere para compra   productos como: tortillas, crema, quesillos cebollas, bolsas, chile, que los utiliza para realizar sus quesillos. petrona expresa que dicha actividad surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo gana muy poco y no cubren las necesidades de hogar, petrona aspira seguir su negocio con la ayuda de fundación y el programa kiva le brinda para tener un medio de vida propio a la personas con escasos recursos y paises pobres como es nicaragua.
texts.en:
Petrona de los Angeles is 28 years of age, married, and has three children. She is from the town of Paz, located in the central part of the west of the country, which is known as a productive area where bricks and hand-made craft products are made. It is also well-known for being home to a typical regional food called “quesillos de Nicaragua”. This is a typical dish, and is made by rolling fresh cheese, chopped cabbage, onion, chile peppers and cream in a tortilla. 

Petrona works selling fresh cheese. Her business consists of selling this cheese on the street, and she works in different cities and universities. This is because for young people, in addition to being a typical, tasty food, it is also a dish that can be eaten quickly, and which can be bought early and eaten later during the day. She has requested this loan to buy products such as tortillas, cream, fresh cheese, onions, bags and chiles, which she will use to make her “quesillos”. Petrona says that her business came about from the need to have income, so that she could help with the household expenses as her husband earns very little, and this is not enough to cover these expenses. 

Petrona hopes to continue with her business, with the help of the Foundation and Kiva, who provide her with the means to have a better way of life for herself and other people with low income in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy tortillas, cream, fresh cheese, onions, bags and chiles, among other items.

loans.name: Blanca Nevai

texts.es:
Doña Blanca Nevai es una profesional, se desempeña como docente en una universidad de Nueva Guinea, la cual ha demostrado gran responsabilidad y honestidad, logro obtener su titulo de master en Docencia Universitaria la cual se siente muy agradecida con la instituciònes una docente muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo,  cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien se desempeña como ingeniero en Zootecnia, son una familia estable, que le encanta progresar tanto material como profesionalmente.

Solicita su  crèdito para invertirlo en gastos de la carrera de Doctorado en Educaciòn con Especialidad en Mediaciòn Pedagogica universidad de la Salle en Costa Rica cada 6 meses tiene que viajar.  Su sueño  es que su familia permanezca unida, bien con Dios y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca Nevai is a professional who works at a university of New Guinea.  She has demonstrated responsibility and honesty.  Blanca was able to earn a Master’s degree in Higher Education, so she is very grateful to the institutions where she has studied.  She is a well-respected instructor among her colleagues.  Blanca has the support of her husband, who works as an engineer for Zootecnia.  They have a stable family and enjoy the financial and professional progress they have made.  

Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the expenses related to her Doctorate degree in Education.  She will specialize in Pedagogical Mediation at the University of La Salle in Costa Rica, where she must travel every six months.  Her dreams include seeing her family permanently unified, being right with God, and having all the basic needs for her home.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for her Doctorate degree.

loans.name: Quetzal Group

texts.es: Gonzálo tiene 35 años de edad y es parte del grupo Quetzal, y que está muy orgulloso de pertenecer a ese grupo ya que es muy cumplido, el se dedica desde hace mas de 11 años a la elaboración de pan en su localidad llamada San Felipe de los Alzati, dice que en su casa venden el pan y que ahí mismo lo elaboran, también hace pedidos para tiendas aledañas a su comunidad y salen a vender en canastos casa por casa y se van a comunidades a venderlo. El y otras dos personas que le ayudan a hacer el pan se levantan a muy temprana hora para empezar a elaborarlo, el hace conchas, cuernitos, flores, teleras, bolillos, borrachitos, semitas, donas, hojaldras etc. Comenta que el quiere pedir un crédito para comprar los insumos que ocupa para hacer su pan como harina, leche, azúcar, colorantes, natas, mantequilla etc. Dice que el espera que le hagan el crédito para poder mejorar sus panes y así comprar productos de mejor calidad, la meta que  tiene Gonzalo es poder comprar una motoneta para trasladarse de un lugar a otro mas rápidamente. Las otras diez integrantes del grupo se llaman Anastasia, Catalina, Maribel, Ma del Pueblito, Noheli Alejandra, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel, Norma Edith y María Concepción y ellas invertirán en sus negocios como en insumos para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos, en insumos para la elaboración de repostería, en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en bisutería para vender, en la compra de frutas y legumbres para su venta, en material para bordar prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Gonzálo is 35 years-old and is part of the Quetzal group, which he's very proud to belong to. Being very reliable, he has been a baker for over 11 years in his community of San Felipe de los Alzati. He says that he bakes and sells his bread at his home and also takes orders from nearby stores in his community, sells door to door from a basket, and goes to other communities to vend. He and the other two people who help him bake get up at a very early hour to start the day and make traditional Mexican baked goods like conchas, cuernitos, flores, teleras, bolillos, borrachitos, semitas, donas, hojaldres, etc. 

He tells us that he is seeking this loan to buy the ingredients he needs to make his breads, including flour, milk, sugar, food coloring, cream, butter, etc. With the loan, he hopes to be able to improve his baked goods, and ultimately buy products of higher quality. His goal is to be able to buy a scooter to get from place to place more quickly. The other 10 members of the group are named Anastasia, Catalina, Maribel, Ma del Pueblito, Noheli Alejandra, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel, Norma Edith, and María Concepción. They will be investing in ingredients and inputs for their businesses making Mexican foods, pastries, costume jewelry, and artisanal knitwear and buying fruits and vegetables to vend and items to stock their stores.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients he needs to make his breads, including flour, milk, sugar, food coloring, cream, butter, etc.

loans.name: El Cacique Group

texts.es: Doña Maria Cristina tiene 45 años de edad y pertenece al grupo llamado El Cacique, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde viven al pie de un cerro que se llama así el Cacique y están orgullosas de vivir en su lugar ya que de ese cerro tiene una espectacular vista ya que es muy alto. Ella se dedica a la cría de vacas para después vender la leche dice que su esposo fue que le enseño a ordeñar las vacas y que tiene con este negocio desde hace mas de 25 años. Dice que desde muy temprana hora del día se levantan ella y su esposo a ordeñar las vacas para vender leche fresca, a diario venden de 25 a 30 litros dependiendo como las vacas den de leche y salen a vender a sus clientes y casa por casa en diferentes localidades. Platica que ella está pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para la compra de alimento, vacunas, desparacitantes para tener en buenas condiciones a sus vacas ya que son 8 y tiene que tenerlas en buenas condiciones para que den leche de calidad. Ella está muy contenta de trabajar con visión fund porque dice que los pagos no se le han hecho pesados, el proyecto que tiene en mente es poner una tiendita de abarrotes para estar así mas al pendiente de su hijo el menor y también para ayudarle con las tareas. Las otras 21 integrantes del grupo se llaman Isidra, Nemesia, Laura Cecilia, Maria Teresa, Alicia, Araceli, Alejandra, Yazmin, Belen, Elsa, Ma. Guadalupe, Rosalinda, Alberta, María Guadalupe, Rosalba, Jannet, Patricia, Tatiana, Mónica, María Guadalupe y Elisenia ellas invertirán sus créditos en la mayoría se dedican a la compra y venta de fruta de temporada, en una pollería para vender pollo por kilo, artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, insumos para hace antojitos mexicanos para vender, surtir ropa para dama, caballeros y niños para vender en su localidad.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 45 years old and belongs to a group called El Cacique. She says they gave this name to the group because they live close to a hill which name is El Cacique and they are very proud to live there, because from that hill, there's a spectacular view, since it's very high.

She is dedicated to breeding cows to sell their milk. She says her husband taught her to milk the cows, and she has had this business for over 25 years. She says that from the early hours in the day, she and her husband get up to milk the cows to sell the milk fresh. They sell from 25 to 30 liters a day, depending on the milk they get from the cows. They go out to sell to their customers door to door in different towns. 

She says she is applying for a loan to Visión Fund to buy food, vaccines, and antiparasitics to have the cows in good condition. She has eight cows and wants to have them in good condition so the milk is of quality. She is very happy to be working with Visión Fund, because the payments aren't that hard. The project she has in mind is to set a small grocery store, so she will be more devoted to her youngest son and also will help him with homework. 

The other 21 members of this group are Isidra, Nemesia, Laura Cecilia, Maria Teresa, Alicia, Araceli, Alejandra, Yazmin, Belen, Elsa, Ma. Guadalupe, Rosalinda, Alberta, María Guadalupe, Rosalba, Jannet, Patricia, Tatiana, Mónica, María Guadalupe y Elisenia. They will invest their loans in activities such as buying and selling seasonal fruit, a poultry that sells chicken by kilos, items to stock a grocery store, supplies to make Mexican food to sell, and women, men and children clothing to sell locally.

loans.use: to buy food, vaccines, and antiparasitics to have the cows in good condition so they have milk of better quality to sell.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín, no tiene por el momento el dinero suficiente para comprar de contado mercadería por mayor, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito para comprarse productos como galletas, dulces, boquitas, bombones, entre otros productos comestibles que considerará al momento de la compra, esto le dará a Joaquín lo necesario para continuar realizando su trabajo.

Manifiesta que con el crédito anterior ha incrementado sus ventas y esto le ha permitido acercarse nuevamente a solicitar un crédito, ya que estos financiamientos le ha permitido estabilizar su situación en el negocio y crear un mejor nivel de ganancias que le permiten a su hogar tener una condición más estable.
texts.en:
Right now Joaquín doesn’t have enough money to buy bulk merchandise. That’s why he’s asking for a loan to buy products like cookies, candy, snacks, chocolates, and other foodstuffs which he’s now considering. That will give Joaquínn what he needs to continue doing his work. 

He says that the last loan has increased his sales and has allowed him to once again request a loan. That funding has allowed him to establish himself in the business and create a better income stream, letting him to maintain his household in a more stable way.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, snacks, and chocolates.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business selling charcoal. He earns about $7 daily. Tha is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase timber to build a new house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la comercialización de medicina natural y es responsable de su hogar, vive con dos hijos el mayor de ellos ya trabaja y colabora, Ella es madre soltera y por lo mismo desempeñan los trabajos como vendedora en diferentes partes ofreciendo productos medicinales a base natural, lleva ya varios años de experiencia y cuenta con una cartera de clientes en una zona cercana de donde reside.

Solicita un préstamo porque desea comprarse un lote de medicamentos en los cuales tendrán suplementos alimenticios, aceites, vitaminas como en hígado de bacalao, algunos laxantes como linaza, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la disposición de medicamentos y asimismo poder satisfacer en mayor porcentaje las demandas de los clientes.

Su aspiración con respecto al crédito es poder darle un nivel adecuado al negocio, con el cual pueda generar más estabilidad y a futuro poder desarrollarse más en el mercado, dentro de sus objetivos familiares estan a futuro poder adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
María sells natural pharmaceuticals and is responsible for her home, where she lives with two sons, the older of which already works with her. She is a single mother and so she works as a mobile vendor of natural pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She already has several years of experience in this and has a base of costumers in the area around where she lives.    

She is seeking this loan because she wants to make a bulk order of pharmaceuticals that will include food supplements, lotions, vitamins such as fish oil and natural laxatives like linseed oil. This investment will allow her to improve her offerings and gain a larger share of her customers' business. 

Her hope with respect to this loan is to be able to adequately supply her business, thereby generating greater stability and in the future to be able to have a greater presence at the market. Among her personal goals is being able to buy her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy lotions and vitamins like fish oil.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y trabaja como jornalero, vive en casa que le fue heredada de sus padres, allí está junto a su esposa y a sus hijos, el realizar trabajos de jornalero y le pagan seis dólares diarios por realizar cualquier ocupación de campo, también realiza la siembra de maíz en una parte del terreno de su propiedad, esta siembra le ayuda para la alimentación de su hogar y si la cosecha es abundante también le permite poder vender una parte y generar ganancias.

El está realizando una nueva siembra para lo cual nos está solicitando un crédito e invertirlo en la compra del abono, ya que no dispone de el dinero para poder comprar los sacos de abono y este material es muy importante para realizar la siembra, ya que fortalece la plantación y aumenta la cosecha, este crédito le ayudará con los recursos para que él pueda realizar su trabajo, dentro de los riesgos está las situaciones climáticas que afectan directamente la producción del cultivo.

El quiere ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y ya que se superen, ésta es su principal aspiración, también espera que su condición económica mejore poco a poco y poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan grows corn, and he works as a day laborer.  He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents.  He lives there with his wife and children.  

He does day laborer work, and they pay him six dollar a day to do any type of field work.  He also grows corn on part of his own land.  This crop helps him feed his household.  If the crop is abundant, he is also able to sell part of it and generate income.

He is starting a new crop, and that is why he is requesting a loan to buy natural fertilizer.  He does not have money available to be able to buy the sacks of fertilizer.  This material is very important for the crop.  It strengthens the plants and increases the harvest.  This loan will help him with the resources so that he will be able to do his work.  Among the risks are the climate situations that directly affect the crop production.

He wants to help his children go to school and be successful.  This is his main aspiration.  He also hopes that his financial situation improves, little by little, and that he will be able to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en:
Leopold is 46 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is married, with three kids. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Desederia is a farmer, and she operates a banana plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years, and every month she earns PHP  3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Desederia been a member of GDMPC since 2009. 

In the future, Desederia hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Siatua

texts.en:
Siatua is a 23 year old single woman, with one child. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Siatua needs a loan to buy a new frying pan and other ingredients for the business. 

She plans to use her profits to help her child's education and family needs. Siatua has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, and a new frying pan.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha is 59 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles and coffee for more than two years, earning approximately $25 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is involved in breeding pigs. He earns about $3 each day. Sitha is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a generator to produce electricity to use in her noodle shop as well as in her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her business and her home

loans.name: Johny Satiel

texts.es:
Johny, es un joven emprendedor, dedicado a la producción audiovisual, haciendo grabaciones de audio, creando pistas musicales, grabando filmaciones de eventos sociales, ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que le demandan su trabajo, el tiene dos años en este oficio vive junto a su familia a quienes les ayuda con sus ingresos.

El está solicitando un crédito por qué lo necesita para realizar la compra de unas puertas de metal para la vivienda, ya que le permitirá proteger la integridad física de su familia y la de él, además estará protegiendo su equipo de trabajo, este crédito será de mucha ayuda para que realice una buena inversion.

Hasta el momento el ha invertido en la compra de equipo de trabajo y espera futuro continuar mejorando la tecnología con nuevas herramientas que se utilizan para seguir generando un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Johny is a young entrepreneur who works in audiovisual production, making audio recordings, creating music tracks, and recording footage of social events. He has a client base, and there is demand for his job. He’s been doing this work for two years. He lives with his family who he helps out with his income. 

He is asking for a loan because he needs it in order to buy some metal doors for his house since that will protect the financial security of Johny and his family. Also, it will protect his work equipment. This loan will be a great help in making a good investment. 

So far he’s invested in the purchase of work equipment, and in the future he hopes to continue improving the equipment with new tools that can be used to continue doing good work.

loans.use: to buy metal doors.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 32 years old. She lives in the village where she generates income. Cherry is married to Dominador, who manages their farmland. She and her husband work hard to always meet their needs. 

Cherry has been engaged in her sari-sari store for six years. She usually earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. She wants to have more products to sell. To make it possible, Cherry is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments to sell. 

With continuous patience and hard work, Cherry's family will achieve a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 46 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. 

She will use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and pay labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a hardworking father and husband to Mary Ann.  They live in the local community of Namnama Alfonso Lista.  

His family's main source of income comes primarily from his farming business. He manages four hectares of corn and half a hectare of rice field. He is glad because his profits were used to cover all their household expenditures, and some amount serves as their savings for emergency purposes.

Rolly raises pigs. He would like to make them healthy and free from any diseases, so he can sell them for greater income.  To fulfill his goal, he requests a loan of PHP 25,000 allowing him to buy the necessary vitamins, vaccines, and stock hog feed. 

He knows that through this loan, he can obtain higher income that will serve to his family daily commodities and education of his only child.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas se dedica a la venta de ropa y cereales en las diferentes ferias. Le gusta su Banco Comunal ya que en ella aprendió a ahorrar, también por que tiene amigas y comparten experiencias diferentes. Estando en la institución logró educar a sus hijos por la cual esta agradecida y lo más importante es que mejoró su calidad de vida.
Con el nuevo préstamo que solicita, lo va invertir en la compra de ropas para así poder mantener el negocio y seguir ayudando a su hijo en cuanto a su educación.
texts.en:
Felicitas works selling clothing and grains in different outdoor markets. She likes her communal bank because she has learned how to save, and because she has friends and they share different experiences. Being in the institution, she managed to educate her children, for which she is grateful. The most important thing is that she improved their quality of life.

With the new loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of clothing so that she can keep her business going and continue helping her son with his education.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medical equipment for health services

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking and responsible man. He is young and business-minded, yet single.  His aim is to help his six siblings finish their studies.

George manages his livestock and, at the same time, his farming and 8,000 square meters of fish pond.  Currently he lives with his parents and siblings.  Since he is the eldest among the family, he is responsible for managing their family farming business.  According to him, farming has been their primary source of income before.  For now, his family has invested some of their profits into their 8,000 square meters of fish pond and their livestock business.

George currently raises six fattening hogs.  He has been taking care of his hogs for two years. He is really thankful to God because his patience and sacrifices have brought a productive outcome to his family.

George is facing a great challenge in life, which is a shortage of capital.  So he is encouraged to apply for a loan of PHP 25,000.  This amount will be use to buy livestock feed and vaccines to ensure proper growth of his raised hogs. He believes in his own principle in life, which is that setting goals higher will push you to strive hard in order to fulfill them.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines to ensure proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 63 years old. Rosita is married and has seven children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and raising cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband (who is pictured with Say and their daughter in the picture) is a soldier who earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about $7 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Say is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run taxi service when he is free from his work. This purchase will help her husband generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a Tuk Tuk to run the taxi service and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a loving wife and responsible mother to her two children. She says, "Everyone aims to have a steady income and a better way of life, but it's our own choice how to get them.” She enjoys farming and loves animals. She farms rice and corn, and two years ago she decided to raise hogs as well.

Marites is now applying for a 25,000 PHP loan from ASKI for pig feed and vaccines. She feels such a loan would result in further growth of her hog business as driven by continued support from lenders and wise management.

As parents, Marites and her husband hope for profitable work so they can educate their two children and provide them with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Joseph provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns about PHP 300 daily. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that he will use to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 40-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Punjab Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and two sons. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past four-years he has also driven a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired.

Robina, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. 

With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. Robina desires to provide quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business.  She is very much thankful to Brac.

loans.use: To repair the engine of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for five years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn, a 33-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Gala, Ozamis City.  For over four years she has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jerlyn joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Jose Transito

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él está dedicado a la siembra de maíz y a la ganadería desde que estaba muy joven, pues lo aprehendió al lado de su padre quien todo el tiempo se dedicó a estas labores.

José hoy necesita un crédito porque está iniciando sus trabajos agrícolas de esta temporada, no cuenta con los recursos económicos para invertir en la compra de semilla, abono, preparación de la tierra, que son los que ayudaría el préstamo a cubrir, con este crédito tendrán la oportunidad de realizar su trabajo sin ningún contratiempo.

El objetivo de él es poder mejorar las ganancias con una buena producción de la siembra de maíz, teniendo la oportunidad de vender parte de la cosecha y así aumentar sus beneficios económicos.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has worked growing corn and raising cattle since he was very young; he learned this work alongside his father, who worked all the time at these tasks.

José now needs a loan because he is beginning his farming work for this season. He doesn't have the economic resources to invest in the purchase of seed, fertilizer, and the preparation of the land, which is what the loan would pay for. With this loan, they will have the opportunity to get the work done without any delays.

His objective is to be able to improve his profits with a good yield from his corn planting, with the opportunity to sell part of the harvest and thereby increase his economic profit margin.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a construction worker, and she is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ramona operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it for a little profit. Most of her products are personal products like lingerie. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales weekly.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW (ready to wear) products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ramona hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia se dedica a vender abarrotes en su tienda, ella cuenta que Finca le ayudó a abrir su tienda, cuenta que le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, también pasa un bonito momento con sus amigas del BC, solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la implementación de su tienda.
texts.en:
Antonia works selling groceries in her shop. She says that FINCA Peru helped her open her shop. She says she likes her communal bank meetings, and she has a lovely time with her friends from the communal bank. 

She is requesting a loan that she will invest in stocking her shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family.
 
He has a store in his home that he runs himself. His store sells electrical appliances to his neighborhood.

Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life and can support their household and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business in order to satisfy the needs of his customers. He will use it to buy more electrical appliances. His dream is to have a bigger selling area and see that his four children have a better future through a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Essivi Victoire's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Victoire la responsable est âgée de 44 ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont 17 ans et 6 ans. Elle vend des divers depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de couvrir la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Victoire se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Victoire, the group's official, is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are in school. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 6. Victoire has been selling various goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and from abroad.
 
Concerned about bolstering her ability to stock supplies and meeting customer demands, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev to maximize her profit and help cover her children's schooling costs. 

Victoire is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase oil, Omo, and all kinds of soaps to sell

loans.name: Andy Kim

texts.en:
Andy Kim, 29, is a single entrepreneur in Pangabuan, Tangub City. He earns income from his transport service business. It's been running for almost three years now, and he earns 4000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Andy Kim is borrowing 5000 PHP from GDMPC (which he joined in 2011) to obtain accessories and tires. Andy Kim is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business soon.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de verduras, ella afirma que con Finca logró sacar profesionales a 3 de sus sobrinos, cuenta que también logró comprar su terreno y pudo abrir su negocio, indica que en sus reuniones aprendió sobre la puntualidad, hacer responsable, también le gustan las capacitación porque le inculcaron muchos valores, solicita un préstamos que lo invertirá en hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas works in agriculture and sells vegetables. She says that with FINCA Peru, she has managed to make professionals out of three of her nieces and nephews. She says that she also managed to buy her land and was able to open her business. She mentions that with FINCA, she has learned about punctuality and being responsible; she also likes the training because they instill many values. 

Felicitas is requesting a loan that she will invest in making her business grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Laurenda Aurore's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Laurenda la responsable est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 02 ans. Laurenda a une boutique où elle vend des divers, des produits cosmétiques et des mèches depuis quelques années. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de contribuer à la bonne éducation de son enfant. Laurenda se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Laurenda, the group's official, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one child, who is 2 years old. Laurenda has had a shop for a few years where she sells a variety of goods, cosmetic products, and hair extensions. 
 
Concerned about bolstering her sales and to fulfill the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to increase her additional income and to help pay for a proper education for her child.
