José, de 36 años, padre de dos niños de 7 y 4 años de edad,  habita en San José de los Remates una pequeña comunidad donde la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, trigo y sorgo es la actividad principal, la mayoría de los habitantes al igual que José se dedican a lo mismo al igual que la compra y venta de ganado. Sus inicios fueron muy duros, gracias al apoyo de su familia logro comprar tierras para siembra. Lleva 6 años trabajando por cuenta propia sembrando y comercializando ganado actividad que realiza cuando la época de siembra es baja.
El está requiriendo un préstamo para comprar vacas y vender leche, pues desea aumentar su producción de venta de leche, lo cual requiere comprar alimentos para ganado y vacunas para mantenerlos sanos y poder vender una leche de calidad. En lo futuro desea comprar más tierras para sembrar más granos básicos y tener la oportunidad de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: José, age 36, has two children ages 4 and 7. He lives in San José de los Remates, a small community where the main activity is farming basic grains such as corn, beans, wheat and sorghum. The majority of the residents, including José, do this work. They also buy and sell livestock. Starting off was very difficult for José. Thanks to the support of his family, he was able to buy land to sow. He has worked for himself for six years, planting crops and selling livestock. He sells the livestock during the low season for crops. He needs a loan for the purchase of cows and to sell milk. He wants to increase his milk sales. To do so, he needs to buy food for livestock and cows in order to keep them healthy; this way, he will be able to sell quality milk. In the future he wants to buy more lands in order to plant more basic grains, and to have the opportunity to offer his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy cows and sell milk.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino , de  55 años de edad , es un humilde campesino habitante de la comarca La Laguna, casado , padre de 6 hijos mayores de edad. Se dedica la agricultura, lleva 45 años en esta actividad, la cual aprendió por medio de su padre quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. La mayoría de sus productos cultivados los vende en Boaco y Managua. Además en su casa su esposa tiene un molino de maíz, servicio que ofrece a la gente de su comunidad.
El solicito un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes para sembrar maíz, pues se acerca el siguiente ciclo de siembra apta para este tipo de cultivo. Su meta próxima es sembrar 3 Manzanas de tierra y pagar su crédito a tiempo, para seguir trabajando y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus nietos quienes son los que lo acompañan.
texts.en: Celestino is 55 years old. He is a farmer who lives in the La Laguna district. He is married and has 6 grown children. He has been working in agriculture for 45 years and he learned from his father who was also a farmer. He sells the majority of his products in the cities of Boaco and Managua. In addition, his wife has a corn mill and offers her services to other people in the community. Celestino is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to plant corn, because the planting season for this type of crop is almost here. His next goal is to plant 3 acres of land, to repay his loan on time, and to continue working so he can improve the quality of life of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to plant corn.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхону 44 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая работает учительницей в средней школе. Он работает бухгалтером в учебной организации и получает маленькую зарплату. Его зарплата не хватает для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Амирхон запрашивает займ  для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Amirkhon is 44 years old. He is married to a wonderful woman who works as a teacher in a junior high school. Amirkhon is a bookkeeper at an educational organization, a job for which he earns a low salary. His wages are not sufficient for him to pay for his son's university studies. Amirkhon is seeking a loan in order to meet the costs of his son's university education. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for his child’s education

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is one of the smartest members of her family. She is 36 years old and has a lovely husband who works in Russia. They are raising three children. Zulfiya tries to provide them with high quality living conditions. With this goal, three years ago she began her own business selling food items. She sells her goods in a shop. She wants to increase the assortment of products she sells because some of her clients are shopping in new super markets. Her income is small and she can’t purchase additional products without help. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy food items in order to increase her product assortment and, in this way, to develop her business. Each month she will make her payment on time. She will be happy if you support her.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Leilua

texts.en:
Leiua is a 19-year-old married woman with one child.
 
She would like to start growing taro crops, taamu crops and bananas to earn a living. 

Leiua has requested a loan to buy equipment to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year.

Leiua will spend her profits to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a grass cutter, and bush knives.

loans.name: Winnie Grace

texts.en:
Winnie Grace of Tangub City helps her family by providing beauty services. 

She’s a 35-year-old married woman with one child who tries her best to earn on her own. For 15 years, she has managed this business and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. 

At present, she needs to purchase additional equipment and tools such as combs and scissors. She joined GDMPC micro finance this year and thanks them for the loan of 15,000 PHP they provided to her. Winnie Grace desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as combs and scissors.

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer, es de oficio agricultor, su nivel de escolaridad es muy básico solo finalizo el 4 grado de primaria, el tiene dos hijas de 12 y 7 años de edad  las cuales están estudiando pues su deseo es que ellas logren ser profesionales. El habita en la comunidad Tierra Colorada, Teustepe. 
Desde los 12 años de edad su papa le enseño a trabajar en el campo, lo que sembraban una parte era para consumo familiar y la otra para vender. Cuando logro independizarse una parte del años trabajo en las fincas de Costa Rica y la otra parte del año en su comunidad. Actualmente esta requiriendo un préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar y pagar mano de obra para las siembras de maíz y frijol. El espera que futuramente su producción aumente, desea comprar ganado para dedicar a la venta y compra, criar terneros.
texts.en: Wilmer is a farmer. He did not go far in school and only completed the 4th grade. He has two daughters, ages 12 and 7, who are in school. They hope to become professionals one day. Wilmer lives in the Tierra Colorada community in Teustepe. When he was 12, his father taught him how to farm. What they grew was partly for the family to consume and partly to sell. When he grew up and was on his own, he would work part of the year on farms in Costa Rica and the other part of the year in his own community. Wilmer is requesting a loan to buy seeds and to pay for the labor necessary to plant corn and beans. He hopes to increase his production and would eventually like to buy and sell livestock and raise calves.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay for the labor necessary to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Sebastiene

texts.en:
Sebastiene is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have five children. 

He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at a previous maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. 

She would like to start growing taro crops, taamu crops and bananas to earn a living. 

Lilia has requested a loan to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. 

Lilia will spend her profits to to help meet her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, weed killer, a wheel barrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim is a 25-year-old business owner who sells charcoal. He has had this business for two years. His business is located in a strategic place in the city of Mombasa, where he has a great number of customers. It is thanks to his work and his business that he has been able to help his parents and give them all that they need for a dignified life, since he is still single. He says that he wants to prepare for his future to live a life worth living when he gets married. He is requesting a loan to be able to stock his store with more sacks of charcoal for resale, as he has a lot of demand and wants to have a enough stock to offer to his customers. He thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 20 years old. She lives in Telavi District with her husband, Aleksandre, her 2-year-old son and her 63-year-old grandmother. 

Eter requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of their low income and poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly pension of Eter’s grandmother. It totals 104 GEL per month. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Eter requested loan from Credo to re-start-up a family business, which was stopped recently because of the illness of the child and financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Eter will purchase a horse. Aleksandre will go to the local forest and use the horse to bring wood from the forest. They will sell the wood in the village and earn income. The wood is mainly used by the village population for ovens to heat the houses and cook. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income of the family. Eter hopes that the income will be enough for the family and the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a horse.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo,  están en el primer ciclo, son 22 mujeres que se organizaron para poder trabajar y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Lilian es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, energizantes y demás. Comenta que tiene muy buena venta, en especial los fines de semanas y feriados y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, energizantes y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa is a very active group. The group is in its first cycle. The 22 female members are organizing themselves in this group to be able to work and to support their families in this way.

Lilian is one of the group’s members. She makes a living from the sale of drinks of all sorts, be it beer, vine, soft drinks, energy drinks or others .She says that her sales are very good especially on weekends and holidays. Due to this she is moving forward. 

She is asking for this loan to purchase beer, vine, energy drinks and others. Lilian is grateful for the development opportunities she and her friends have.

loans.use: to purchase beer, vine, energy drinks and others.

loans.name: Mujeres De Tajy Group

texts.es:
Mujeres de Tajy es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, donde las 12 miembros trabajan arduamente y se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Angelina es la presidenta del grupo Tiene despensa propia en su casa, también vende bebidas varias y comidas. Ayuda a las demás compañeras en todo sentido, es muy responsable y honesta.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser panificados, lácteos, bebidas, yerba, azúcar y demás. Todas ellas están contentas por formar parte del grupo que les esta ayudando muchísimo.
texts.en:
The 12 members of Mujeres de Tajy, in the city of Villa Elisa, support the efforts of each of the others to get ahead in the world.
Sra. Angelina is the president of the group.  She operates a corner shop where she sells soft drinks and other merchandise.  She is responsible, honest and supportive of her fellow members.  She is applying for a loan that she use to buy baked goods, drinks, herbal tea supplies, sugar, etc.  The members say that they are very happy to be part of a group that has helped them so much.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Francisco Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisco, originario de la comunidad el Llano en las afueras de Teustepe, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, desde hace 15 años, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad el cual estudia en una escuelita rural cerca de la comunidad. Desde los 12 años trabaja en las siembras y en la crianza de animales actividades que le enseño su padre.  El siembra maíz, frijol y sorgo, sus hermanos le ayudan con las labores de siembra, vende sus productos en la ciudad de Juigalpa. El solicito el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes semilla, gasolina para motor de riego para sus cultivos de frijol y maíz. Del cual espera una producción de mejor calidad y buenos rendimientos. También le gustaría comprar ganado de raza para  vender. Por lo pronto está en busca de nuevas rutas de ventas de sus cultivos y criar animales para conseguir el alimento y darles un mejor  estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco, from the community of Llano in the outskirts of Teustepe, has been a farmer for 15 years. He has a four-year-old who goes to a small rural school located near their community. He started planting crops and raising animals 12 years ago; his father taught him this work. He sows corn, beans, and sorghum. His brothers help him with the planting. He sells his products in the city of Juigalpa. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of manure, fertilizers, seeds, and gas for the motorized irrigation machine which he uses for his beans and corn. He hopes to have a higher quality harvest after this investment. He would also like to buy bred livestock to sell. At the moment, he is looking for new ways to sell his crops and raise animals. This will allow him to feed his family and provide them with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, and gasoline for the irrigation machine which he uses for his bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo, se encuentra en el ciclo 1º, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y comentan que están muy entusiasmadas por llegar hasta el máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Diana es una de las miembros, siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta y a la vez comprensiva, ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de helados de todos los sabores, cuenta que gracias a que el clima es siempre cálido esta siempre con muchas ventas y buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de  helados de diferentes sabores, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad, ya que se acerca el tiempo donde hace más calor y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
This community bank is launching its first round of funding.  Its members are learning to work together and say that they hope to reach the maximum level the program allows.
One of the bank's members, Sra. Diana, knows what's required to run a business.  She is flexible, but also very precise. She tells us that she runs an ice cream sales business and adds that the hot climate here has contributed to her success.
Sra. Diana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy different flavors of ice cream.  The investment will allow her to stock up for what will soon be the hottest part of the year.

loans.use: to stock her ice cream sales business.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. With the cooperation of her husband, Shadia has been able to satisfy her family's needs and provide a fair way of living.  She owns a small mini-market where she sells all kinds of dairy and daily-use products in addition to soft drinks and many other items. Shadia's husband has his own independent business. 

Shadia is requesting a loan from the Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed food provisions for her mini-market. She hopes to diversify her offerings to increase her revenue and therefore improve her family's way of living. In the future, Shadia hopes to expand her grocery. She is waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign her children ownership of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase needed food provisions for her mini-market

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 37-year-old enthusiastic, married woman. Five years ago she started her own hand embroidery business to support her family. Married life has been very difficult for Majeedan. Her husband is employed in a small retail shop and his income is unpredictable and insufficient to cover their everyday expenditures. These conditions forced Majeedan to start her own business to support her family. With the help of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business and is gaining fame in her community. Majeedan's clients are increasing after seeing her fabulous work. 

Majeedan is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan to help continue her operation and buy stock of different-colored threads, pearls, and needles. Her loan will help her to more consistently meet customer demand. Majeedan is very hopeful that this loan will enable her to work better and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors, pearls, and needles for her embroidery business

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kyre'y es un grupo formado por doce mujeres de la ciudad de Lambaré, donde todas trabajan arduamente y se esfuerzan por salir.
Liz es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, cuenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo está saliendo adelante y también ayuda a su familia. Liz es el sostén de su casa y desea seguir creciendo y el día de mañana ser una gran comerciante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y vendiendo sus productos. Agradecen todas ellas por el gran apoyo que están recibiendo, ya que de esta forma podrán seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the Kyre'y community bank in Lambare are working hard to get ahead in the world.
Liz is a member of the group.  She operates a cosmetics sales business and says that her hard work is starting to pay off.  She tells us, too, that her income is the main source of income for her family.  For the future, she wants to own a larger business.  Liz is applying for a loan that she will use to buy all kinds of cosmetics that she will then sell on to her cusomters.  The members of the community bank say that they are grateful for your support because your loans are helping them grow their businesses.

loans.use: Comprar cosméticos para la venta.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 67 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his wife, Naili, his grown son, daughter-in-law, two grandsons (14 and 19 years old), and mother. His elder grandson is a student and the younger goes to the local school. Ivane has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for his family business start-up without any success. His loan request has been rejected many times because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly pension of Ivane and his mother. His son works as an operator in a private concrete company and Naili serves at the factory to get a small monthly income. The family earns a total of 620 GEL per month which is hardly enough to provide food for a seven-member family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Ivane is requesting a loan from Credo to re-start-up his family business which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to purchase pigs to start an animal husbandry business. He will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. Ivane's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Ivane's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose , es casado, padre de 4 hijos, habitante de la comunidad El Bálsamo , de oficio agricultor. Su abuelo lo crio y le enseño a trabajar en la tierra, preparar el terreno, limpiar, poner las semillas en el lugar correcto, como negociar los precios de sus cultivos muy a pesar de que el no tuvo una educación escolar , pues dedico su vida a trabajar en la tierra. Cuando la época de siembra es baja viaja a Costa Rica  a trabajar como jornalero en las fincas y luego regresa para el siguiente ciclo de siembra. Una de sus satisfacciones es saber que sus cultivos son muy demandados por clientes que vienen  de fuera de Teustepe, por eso es la necesidad de ampliar sus áreas de siembra. Él está requiriendo el préstamo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar maíz, frijoles y sorgo. Este crédito le ayudara a darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos, sacar su producción a tiempo. Uno de sus planes es comprar animales para criar y vender y conseguir otros ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar la calidad de vida de  su familia.
texts.en: Jose is married with four children. He lives in the community of El Bálsamo and is a farmer. His grandfather taught him to work the land: how to prepare it, clear it, plant seeds in the right spot; how to negotiate the prices of his crops despite not having an education. He has dedicated his life to working the land. During the low season, he travels to Costa Rica to work as a day labourer on farms there. He later returns for the second sowing cycle. One of his great satisfactions in life is knowing that his crops are in great demand from clients who come from outside of Teustepe. For this reason, he needs to expand his production. He needs this loan for the purchase of supplies and to pay labourers to sow corn, beans, and sorghum. this loan will help him to better maintain his crops and to bring them in on time. One of his plans is to buy animals to raise and sell; this will bring in an additional income which will help him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay the labourers for sowing corn, beans, and sorghum.

loans.name: Miyasar

texts.en:
Miyasar is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of five, whose ages range from 24 to 32 years old. She has worked in an aluminum factory for 10 years. She is one of the best workers there, but her salary is not enough to rebuild the house that she began some years ago. Her family is large and so she needs to enlarge her house. 

She is asking for a loan of 4,500 somoni to buy materials such as wood and cement for building a new house. In this way she will provide a better standard of living for her family and put an end to the problems with the house. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy materials, such as wood and cement, for building a new house

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
This is Edgar, 37, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is single and manages his household while operating his clothing business. Edgar works hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. He sells men and women's clothing, buying merchandise wholesale and selling it to make a profit. Edgar also runs a general store to earn additional income. His customers are attracted to his low prices and inventory. Edgar's regular customers are neighbors and local community members. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP daily. 
 
Edgar is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy ready-to-wear products and other merchandise to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands. Edgar hopes to continue to expand his business and dreams of having an abundant life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise needed in his business

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
El Sr. Atilano es cliente recurrente de fundación, está casado con la Sra. Silvia y  viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. El  titular de la cuenta es técnico en TV desde el año 1972.
Gracias a todos los años que lleva en el ramo ya tiene mucha clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y eso le ayuda mucho. Desea seguir creciendo y también de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de tornillos y soldador. Con todas las herramientas correspondientes para su trabajo  le dará un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Atilano is a long-standing client of the bank.  He and his wife, Sra. Silvia, live in a house they own in the city of Luque.  He has operated a TV repair business since 1972.  
He has many loyal customers because he has provided a useful and reliable service for many, many years now.  He wants to continue growing the business, he says, because it is provides the income he needs to support his family.  
Sr. Atilano is applying for a loan that he will use buy the supplies--screws, solder--he needs to work.  The investment will provide him with a better operating margin and, in turn, a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his electronics repair business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes's daughter, now in senior six, will be able to complete her final year this term. The other two children are also progressing in school. Agnes is so grateful for UGAFODE and the lenders Kiva has brought her. Her children have been able to attend decent schools because of the loans, which would have been different if it had not been for the support of the loans. Her poultry business is also booming since she does not have to stretch it by drawing working capital from it.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a shop since 2007 where he sells agricultural supplies such as fertilizers. He is the main income source of the family, and he works hard to provide his family with enough money to live in good conditions. 

He is asking to borrow from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed agricultural supplies. He intends to increase his business sales to get extra income and enhance his family’s way of living. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase needed agricultural supplies, such as pesticides and fodder, for resale.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike is in her early 50s and married with three teenaged children who are attending school. Her family lives in northeast Albania and they have struggled financially. For awhile, Mrike's family had had no income except what they produced at home. Ten years ago, Mrike started her own livestock business. With the help from VisionFund Albania, she got her first loan that she invested in buying milk cows. Since then, Mrike has built a good clientele and her income has improved. She and her family are all happy now. 

Mrike is requesting a loan to build a stable for her animals before winter starts. She is hoping that lenders will help her, as they have others. Mrike is aware of the kindness of lenders and this makes her smile.

loans.use: to build a stable before winter starts

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for seven years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he hopes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire farm machinery that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and to support labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita, who is 46 years old, is one of several TLM clients who were funded by KIVA lenders in June 2012. She received a loan of IDR 4,000,000 that was spent on kiosk stocks and duck food; she could even initiate a chicken rearing business. 

The additional kiosk stocks and adequate duck food really support the improvement of her businesses. Tabita recognized that she was able to better meet her family needs. Tabita fully repaid her loans in August 2012. 

She is now planning to build three rooms to lease out. To implement her plan, Tabita is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase building materials for the job, i.e., cement, brick, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy building materials, i.e., cement, brick, sand, etc., and add three rooms to lease out.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 26 year old, married, and has two children. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, margarine, pain killers, etc . He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a viable business environment and his primary customers are local residents. 

Benard is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy household items.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will run a profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris, aged 42, is a single mother with three children who are 15, 10, and 5 years old. She also supports two other family members. Peris runs a restaurant and has been doing so for three years with a monthly income of KES 9,600. This is her second loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD due to her consistent loan repayment. She will use the funds to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar. Peris hopes to open a big modern restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar for her restaurant

loans.name: Despiner

texts.en:
Despiner is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Despiner has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this retail business for four years selling to all types of people. She works seven days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Despiner aspires to become a wholesaler and earn enough profit to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá, el tiene una tapicería que se encuentra en un lugar estratégicamente ubicado en la ciudad de Itá, tiene clientes formados desde hace más de 6 años. El cuenta también con una parada de taxis, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan.
El señor Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de un vehículo, con lo cual podrá tener un taxi más con lo cual podrá aumentar sus ingresos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan, 40, lives in the city of Ita.  He owns an upholstery business on a well-trafficked street in the city.  He tells us that he has owned the business for 6 years and has many loyal customers.  He also owns a taxi business, a second source of much-needed income for his family.  
Sr. Juan is applying for a loan that he will use to buy another vehicle.  The investment will help him increase his income from the taxi business and, in turn, better support his family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Son 12 mujeres muy emprendedoras y luchadoras que se han unido con el fin de salir adelante y eliminar la pobreza.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, etc. Ellas han visto una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación para poder seguir progresando.
Virginia solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, con los cuales podrá alimentar a sus animales y seguir ayudando también a su familia con los mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” communal bank was created when several neighbours from the city of Santaní joined together. The group is made up of 12 very hard-working women who have come together with the goal of getting ahead and eliminating poverty.
All of the members raise and sell barnyard animals such as hens and hogs. They see great opportunities for progress in the Fundacion's program.
Virginia is requesting this loan for the purchase of animal feed. With it, she will be able to feed her animals and continue helping her family with her increased income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as dedicated. 

He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts and brake fluid. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located within a busy market,  and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of brake fluid. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts and brake fluid. His goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he has a family and can educate his children and build a house for them. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy brake fluid and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 50-year-old woman. She lives with her three children, two of whom are working; the other is still attending school. Despite her older age, Marie is obliged to work continually as she is responsible for supporting her children. Although she still receives her husband’s monthly salary after his death, she thought to open her own laundry, in addition to selling lingerie, towels, drapes and many other items, to better improve their way of living. She provides her customers with good quality at fair prices. 

She’s asking to borrow from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more products and better develop her laundry. In the near future, Marie wishes to expand her business and maybe hire new employees and therefore earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase more products for resale and to better develop her laundry

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 24 years old. She lives with her two children and her husband in the suburban area of Likoni. Asha opened a grocery store at home six months ago and she sells various food items such as basic grains, sugar, coffee, bread, snacks, and soft-drinks. 

Asha is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy flour, sugar, rice, and other items. She intends to increase her sales because she'll stock more items that her customers need. Ahsa will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice, and other items

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 58-year-old man who is married with two sons and two daughters. He works as a bus driver for a local kindergarten and also works in agriculture to earn additional income. Sameer's work is profitable, but he needs more support to cover its cost.

Sameer is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing and insuring the bus he drives. His loan will enable him to be a safer driver and move freely from one area to another. In this photograph, Sameer appears in the bus he drives.

loans.use: to license and insure the kindergarten bus he drives

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins  is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as focused and patient. For the past three years, Collins has operated a poultry business where he sells chicken. His business is located in a busy environment and his primary customers are hotels and restaurants. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve his business. 

Collins is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy chickens to sell. This is his first loan. His business goal is to start rearing and selling pigs within five years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 29 years old and married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for nine years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire farm machinery that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to support labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
This is Juvelyn, 36 years old, who is a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to George and mother of four children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Juvelyn believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Juvelyn operates an Internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the net and any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juvelyn dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking woman who has the urge to move forward. She has been operating a video cafe for several years and decided to start a juice and fish selling business. Fatuma is requesting her fifth loan, which she will use to repair her freezer. Her dream is to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to repair her freezer.

loans.name: Kayizali

texts.en:
Kayizali is 21 years old and single. He has been a maize farmer for eight years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire farm machinery that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to support labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Exemple De Borddemer 1, 2, 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Jodelin est le coordinateur de son groupe Exemple de Borddemer. Il est un commercant. Il habite dans la région  BOR-DE-MER  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.  Jodelin a dirigé son  commerce de produit divers pendant 10 années.

Jodelin voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la acheter de produit divers. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc

Jodelin dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son  fond et par la  grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Jodelin is the coordinator of the Exemple de Borddemer group. He is a shopkeeper. He lives in the region of Bor-de-mer where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

Jodelin has managed his business of selling various goods for 10 years. He would like to use this loan to invest in buying various goods, such as shoes, clothes, and cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Jodelin says that the principal challenge is to become a great shopkeeper. He says that his main goal and dream is to have a large business by his work and the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Abedal-Raheem

texts.en:
AbedAl-Raheem is 28 years old, married and has three children. He is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

AbedAl-Raheem is requesting a loan for $1,200 from FATEN, which he will use to purchase a water purification filter for his house. The filter will provide his family with healthy drinking water, so they can enjoy living in better health.

loans.use: To purchase a water purification filter.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 35-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 10 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be social and warm.

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes.  She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located at a strategic business environment, and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be high rates of city council business operation charges. 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by family members to light the house during evening hours. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Menday K.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, is very pleased to present you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 6,400,000 to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Tamba is the leader of this group of teachers. Tamba was born in Bumpeh, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is 58 years old.  He is married to a pretty trader and he has nine children  –  three in primary school and three in secondary school.  Tamba has been a teacher for 37 years now. He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is married and has three children. To improve his children's living conditions, he started raising livestock, which he has been doing for 22 years. He sells the meat at the bazaar. 

Rovshan is requesting a loan for 1,600 AZN, which he will use to buy a few head of sheep.  He plans to expand his business and start raising sheep for wool selling. From the income he plans to build a stall in his own yard, because he currently keeps his cattle in a stall in his brother's yard.

loans.use: to purchase a few head of sheep.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 55 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for eight years. He will use Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at a previous maize ground. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod is 47 years old. He lives in a house which is in bad condition. His wife, who stays at home, is a kind woman. They have three clever children.  Murod must finish the building of new house as he began some years ago. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy building materials to continue building the new house. In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and stability, which will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy. Please help him and his family if possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement, to build a new house.

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett is 33 years old and single.  She lives Payatas, Philippines.  She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Janett operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Janett is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Janett hopes that her business will expand and have more customers who will patronize her food stall. 

Janett faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

Ingredients

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: Ademar,es un agricultor, casado, padre de 8 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Puntarenas, Costa Rica, se dedica a la siembra de café, cuando recoge la cosecha la  vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad . Ademar necesita aumentar la producción de café para ello solicita seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas) e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su siembra . Su numerosa familia colabora en todo el proceso desde la siembra hasta la recolección, los gastos familiares son muy grandes, por lo que cada uno pone todo su esfuerzo para ayudar a su padre en esta actividad, cada año don Ademar siembra nuevas plantas para que su cafetal se valla renovando . Dice haber encontrado una gran oportunidad de crecimiento y un medio de obtener crédito accesible a personas que como él necesitan este tipo de ayuda financiera.
texts.en:
Ademar is a farmer who is married and the father of 8 children. He lives in the city of Puntarernas, Costa Rica. Ademar cultivates coffee trees and after gathering the harvest, he sells the beans in his community's collection centers.

Ademar needs to augment coffee production. That's why he is borrowing 600,000 colons, to buy small coffee plants and inputs so that he can maintain his plantings. 

Each member of his numerous family collaborates in the entire process, from sowing to harvesting. Family expenses are very large, and as a result, all the members devote all their efforts to helping their father in this activity. Each year, Ademar sows new plants so that his coffee grove will be renewed. He feels he has found a grand opportunity for growth and a means of obtaining accessible credit for persons like him who need this type of financial aid.

loans.use: buy small coffee plants and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been in the carpentry business in Nakuru town for the last three years.  He is 45 years old, married to Pamela, and they have two children, aged 14 years and 3 years.

Stephen has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more timber to use in his carpentry shop. He will then be able to meet the demands of his clients. 

In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his business and supply furniture to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to  buy timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is happy that she is now married and has a young child who is a source of joy in her marriage. She used her previous loan to invest in her clothes-selling business. Now, she has a beauty salon which is doing well. She offers her customers hairstyling, haircuts, hair color, nail treatments, etc. She also sells products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, etc. She has the business in her small area, and she is very well-known in the neighborhood.

She will use the requested loan to buy beauty products to use in the salon and to sell. Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get her family ahead and to be able to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 41, is a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jonald, a family driver, and they have five children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the entire working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (cooked food) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sahr H.'s Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers from the Eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have requested for a loan 8,800,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf. Bernadette is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono, 51 years ago, Bernadette has been in the teaching profession for 28 years now. She is single with five children, three in primary school and two in secondary school. She has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for her children and also to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and also to buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30 years old and married.  To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been in the business for over five years. Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management, she has improved her business.  She has also learned how to save her money.

Jane has requested KES 20,000 to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 23 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for his maize fields. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken at the previous maize field, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La socia es la señora Elena, ahora con 58 años de edad, ella continúa con su actividad económica de confección y venta de ropa de lana para damas, caballeros y niños, y los comercializa de forma directa a sus clientes y a solicitud. Elena en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar actividad y comprar diferentes tipos y colores de fibras de lanas, accesorios e hilos. Elena está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en la educación del menor de sus hijos que esta estudiando en la universidad. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Elena, who is now 58-years-old, continues with her economic activity which is making wool clothing for women, men and children to sell.  She sells directly to her customers and to order.  On this occasion, Elena is requesting a loan to capitalize her activity and buy various types of wool yarn in assorted colors, accessories and thread.  

Elena is very grateful for Kiva’s help because it helped her strengthen her economic activity that allows her to provide better quality of life for her family and with her youngest son’s education; he’s attending university.  She is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy various types of wool yarn in assorted colors, accessories and thread.

loans.name: Abedal-Rahman

texts.en:
Abedal-Rahman, who appears in the picture, is a 34-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and two daughters. He is a construction worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Abedal-Rahman has been working in the construction supplies business, supplying construction workshops with wood and iron. This has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs. Abedal-Rahman is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more construction supplies of wood and iron. This will improve his work quality and increase demand from his customers. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more construction supplies of wood and iron

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy, 50, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Godofredo and a mother to her children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Remy hopes to give her children a good and high quality education, and she dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Nery Reyna

texts.es: Nery es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 12 años. Tiene 36 años es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Estando en Finca logrÓ comprar su terreno. Actualmente Nery tiene un recreo en un local alquilado. Comenta que se supero por que aprendió a invertir de manera adecuada el dinero. Las capacitaciones son muy interesantes ya que motivan a seguir emprendiendo. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en el acabado de su casa. El sueño que tiene Nery es comprar un carro y formar su empresa de transportes.
texts.en: Nery has been a member of FINCA Perú for 12 years.  She’s 36-years-old, married and the mother of three children.  Being in FINCA Perú she succeeded in buying a piece of land.  She currently leases a snack bar.  She comments that she improved because she learned how to invest her money properly.  The training sessions are very interesting because they motivate her to continue being an entrepreneur.  She will use the new loan she’s requesting to do some home improvements.  Nery’s dream is to buy a car and set up a transportation firm.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Jose Ramón, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Don Jose se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas y hace un año decidió realizar el cultivo de chile picante, ya que tiene buena demanda. Anteriormente vendía mariscos. la producción de chile la vende en el mercado local y nacional. El ha obtenido el apoyo financiero de ODEF en varios ciclos, actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar una maquina de chapear o deshierbar el cultivo  de chile picante. Con esta herramienta va ahorrar pago de mano de obra y tiempo y dará mejor mantenimiento. El tiene como meta lograr la compra de un terreno propio para sus cultivos ya que donde cultiva actualmente es alquilado.
texts.en:
José Ramón, 39, is married and has four children; he lives with his family in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  José works in agriculture and a year ago decided to start growing hot chili peppers because they are in high demand.  He used to sell seafood.  He sells his chili peppers in the local and the national market.  

He’s had several cycles of ODEF support and he’s now asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy a weeder for his hot chili pepper crops.  With this tool he will save on labor costs and time and will provide better crop care.  His goal is to buy his own farmland because the land he currently farms is leased.

loans.use: to buy a weeder for his hot chili pepper crops.

loans.name: Nora Concepcion

texts.es: Nora, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Nora tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, hace tres años inicio un negocio en su casa donde vende variedad de comidas y como otros ingresos confecciona cortinas y sabanas. El negocio de comidas lo atiende el fin de semana, vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella ha obtenido cuatro préstamos con ODEF lo que le ha permitido mantener estable su negocio. El préstamo actual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas como harina, manteca, carnes, lácteos, condimentos, etc. y compra de utensilios de cocina. Espera que su negocio sea más rentable y poder seguir trabajando. Su meta es trabajar duro para lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Nora, 37, is married and has a son; she lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  Nora has her own source of income.  Three years ago she started a home-based business selling food and as an additional source of income she makes curtains and sheets.  The food business is on weekends; she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner.  

She’s had four ODEF loans that have helped her to keep her business stable.  She will use her current 22,000 Lempira loan to buy ingredients like flour, lard, meat, dairy products, condiments, etc. needed to prepare her meals; she will also buy kitchen utensils.  She hopes her business will be more profitable and to be able to stay in business.  Her goal is to work hard to have a better standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 34 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. She will use her Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken on the previous maize field, which the borrower will still use for this new season. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cover the cost of labor in maize production

loans.name: Claudia Gloribel

texts.es: Claudia de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella ha establecido su propio negocio en su casa desde hace mas de tres años, donde vende variedad de comida como ser: pollo frito con tajadas, Chuleta frita, almuerzos, baleadas (tortillas de harina rellenas con frijoles, queso, huevo etc.) y refrescos. Atiende este negocio todos los días de lunes a sábado. Es un negocio rentable ya que tiene su clientela fija. y lo ha mantenido estable y surtido mediante préstamos que ODEF ha otorgado. El préstamo actual que solicita es el número ocho y es por 28,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más insumos (harina, carnes, granos básicos, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, etc.) que utiliza para la elaboración de comidas, con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas y tener siempre los insumos a la disposición. Tiene planes de ampliar el negocio y obtener más ingresos para un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Claudia, 43, is married and has four children; she lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. She’s had a home-based business for three years where she sells food like fried chicken with fried plantain slices, fried chops, lunches, ‘baleadas’ (flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese, egg, etc.) and soft-drinks.  She works every day from Monday through Saturday.  It’s a profitable business that already has a regular clientele.  She’s kept it stable and well-stocked thanks to the loans ODEF has granted her.  The current loan is her 8th and it’s for 28,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy ingredients (flour, meat, basic grains, lard, condiments, soft-drinks, etc.) that she uses to prepare her meals.  Her goal is to increase sales and to always have ingredients on hand.  She plans to expand the business and earn more income to have a better standard of living

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Goberlinda

texts.es: Rosa es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 7 años. Tiene 52 años es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Rosa tiene una tienda donde vende mochilas. Esta muy contenta porque aprendió a ahorrar. Las capacitaciones son de su agrado y le parecen muy interesantes y bonitas ya que le ayudan mucho tanto en el negocio, como en su vida familiar. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of FINCA Perú for seven years. She is 52 years old, married, and mother of three children. Rosa has a store where she sells backpacks. She is very happy because she learned how to save. She likes the trainings and she thinks they are interesting and good, because they help her a lot in her business and in her family life.

The new loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a lot.

loans.use: to buy a lot.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 46-year-old active, married woman.  She has been doing excellent work of hand embroidery at her home for the last 5 years. She has exceptional skills for doing it. She has gotten a lot of admiration from her community members. The demand for her collection is increasing day by day. She is contributing to the family income. Her husband is employed in a small shop repairing bicycles and one of her son operates a food cart. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of thread and sequins in different colors to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery designs as her customer base is varied and diverse.  She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of thread and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 46, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a carpenter, and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor y menor. Ella se siente agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de los préstamos que ofrece. Comenta que las capacitaciones son muy interesantes. Modesta con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor y una parte para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Modesta sells fruit at wholesale and retail.  She feels very grateful to the institution for the ease with which it grants loans.  She comments that the training sessions are very interesting.    Modesta will use the new loan she’s requesting to buy fruit at wholesale;  part of the loan will be used for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jose Abad

texts.es: Jose, tiene 57 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Tela. Don Jose tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la ganadería, el tiene un terreno grande donde mantiene las vacas productoras de  leche, la producción de leche la vende en el mercado local. También don Jose inicio otro negocio en su casa hace aproximadamente cuatro meses de venta de golosinas como ser: refrescos, churros, variedad de dulces, topogigios (helados de leche o sabor a fruta). En busca de generar otros ingresos decidió solicitar un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de golosinas que tiene en su casa. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener más ingresos y poderle ayudar más a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
José, 57, is married and has four children; he lives in Tela.  He’s been a cattleman for 20 years; he has a large piece of land where he keeps dairy cows.  He sells the milk in the local market.  

José has also started a new business at home about four months ago selling snacks like soft-drinks, packaged snacks, assorted candy, topogigios (milk or fruit based frozen treats).  

Seeking to earn additional income, he decided to request a 5,000 Lempira loan to stock the snack shop he has at home.  His plant is to make the business grow to earn more income and be able to help his children more with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft-drinks, cookies and candy to stock his new business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old young man. He is married and the father of one son and one daughter.

For the past four years, Mohammad has been working in agriculture. He has a greenhouse where he plants different types of vegetables, which has been a profitable project, and the only source of income for the family, but he also needs more support to cover the cost. He is requesting a 1,500-USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing agricultural fertilizers. It will allow Mohammad to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Mohammad is photographed inside the greenhouse he has.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg, 52, is a cook in a restaurant in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for 11 years nonstop. She lives with her family in the ger district of Mongolian nomadic yurts and houses in the boundary of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She wanted to repair her house. In winter, her house becomes cold and has a heat loss through some parts of the house. The walls and door have been damaged too much and became very bad. She is planning to make the wall insulation by foam, sand and cement and replace the new wooden door. She totally believes that her family can live in comfort and stay warm at home in winter after the repair. She is requesting a loan to buy the building materials including metal board roof, wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.use: To buy the building materials including metal board roof, wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha, who is 42 years old, is a married woman with nine children and lives in the outskirts of Mombasa.

She decided to start her own source of income seven years ago. She sells fish at the market.  She asked Yehu for a previous loan to keep her business stocked. This business is her source of income to cover household expenses.
